content: 1 A man there was—in the land of Uz､ Job his name,—and that man was blameless and upright, and one who revered God､ and avoided evil.
content_old: 1 A man there was—in the land of Uz､ Job his name,—and that man was blameless and upright, and one who revered God､ and avoided evil.

content: 2 And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
content_old: 2 And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.

content: 3 And his substance was—seven thousand sheep､ and three thousand camels､ and five hundred yoke of oxen､ and five hundred she-asses, and a body of servants exceeding large,—thus was that man the greatest of all the sons of the East.
content_old: 3 And his substance was—seven thousand sheep､ and three thousand camels､ and five hundred yoke of oxen､ and five hundred she-asses, and a body of servants exceeding large,—thus was that man the greatest of all the sons of the East.

content: 4 Now his sons were wont to go､ and make a banquet, at the house of each one upon his day,—and to send and call their three sisters, to eat and to drink with them.
content_old: 4 Now his sons were wont to go､ and make a banquet, at the house of each one upon his day,—and to send and call their three sisters, to eat and to drink with them.

content: 5 And so it was､ when the days of the banquet came round､ that Job sent and hallowed them､ and rising early in the morning offered ascending-sacrifices､ according to the number of them all; for Job said, Peradventure my sons have sinned, And have cursed God in their hearts. Thus and thus was Job wont to do all the days.
content_old: 5 And so it was､ when the days of the banquet came round､ that Job sent and hallowed them､ and rising early in the morning offered ascending-sacrifices､ according to the number of them all; for Job said, Peradventure my sons have sinned, And have cursed God in their hearts. Thus and thus was Job wont to do all the days.

content: 6 Now there came a certain day, when the sons of God entered in to present themselves unto Yahweh,—so the accuser also entered､ in their midst.
content_old: 6 Now there came a certain day, when the sons of God entered in to present themselves unto Yahweh,—so the accuser also entered､ in their midst.

content: 7 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Whence comest thou? And the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and wandering about therein.
content_old: 7 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Whence comest thou? And the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and wandering about therein.

content: 8 And Yahweh said unto the accuser, Hast thou applied thy heart unto my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a man blameless and upright､ one revering God and avoiding evil?
content_old: 8 And Yahweh said unto the accuser, Hast thou applied thy heart unto my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a man blameless and upright､ one revering God and avoiding evil?

content: 9 And the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, Is it for nought that Job revereth God?
content_old: 9 And the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, Is it for nought that Job revereth God?

content: 10 Hast not thou thyself made a hedge about him､ and about his house､ and about all that he hath､ on every side? The work of his hands thou hast blessed, and his substance hath broken forth in the land.
content_old: 10 Hast not thou thyself made a hedge about him､ and about his house､ and about all that he hath､ on every side? The work of his hands thou hast blessed, and his substance hath broken forth in the land.

content: 11 But in very deed put forth､ I pray thee､ thy hand, and smite all that he hath,—verily unto thy face will he curse thee.
content_old: 11 But in very deed put forth､ I pray thee､ thy hand, and smite all that he hath,—verily unto thy face will he curse thee.

content: 12 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Lo! all that he hath is in thy hand, only against himself do not put forth thy hand. So the accuser went forth from the presence of Yahweh.
content_old: 12 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Lo! all that he hath is in thy hand, only against himself do not put forth thy hand. So the accuser went forth from the presence of Yahweh.

content: 13 And there came a certain day,—when his sons and his daughters were eating､ and drinking wine, in the house of their eldest brother.
content_old: 13 And there came a certain day,—when his sons and his daughters were eating､ and drinking wine, in the house of their eldest brother.

content: 14 And a messenger came in unto Job､ and said,— The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them;
content_old: 14 And a messenger came in unto Job､ and said,— The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them;

content: 15 when the Sabeans swooped down､ and took them, and the young men smote they with the edge of the sword,—and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.
content_old: 15 when the Sabeans swooped down､ and took them, and the young men smote they with the edge of the sword,—and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.

content: 16 Yet was this one speaking when another came in and said,— A fire of God fell out of the heavens, and burned up the sheep and the young men､ and consumed them; and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.
content_old: 16 Yet was this one speaking when another came in and said,— A fire of God fell out of the heavens, and burned up the sheep and the young men､ and consumed them; and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.

content: 17 Yet was this one speaking when another came in and said, The Chaldeans appointed three chiefs､ and spread out against the camels､ and took them, and the young men smote they with the edge of the sword; and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.
content_old: 17 Yet was this one speaking when another came in and said, The Chaldeans appointed three chiefs､ and spread out against the camels､ and took them, and the young men smote they with the edge of the sword; and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.

content: 18 Yet was this one speaking when another came in and said,— Thy sons and thy daughters were eating､ and drinking wine, in the house of their eldest brother;
content_old: 18 Yet was this one speaking when another came in and said,— Thy sons and thy daughters were eating､ and drinking wine, in the house of their eldest brother;

content: 19 when lo! a great wind came from over the desert､ and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men､ and they died,—and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.
content_old: 19 when lo! a great wind came from over the desert､ and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men､ and they died,—and escaped am only I alone to tell thee.

content: 20 Then Job arose､ and rent his robe, and shaved his head, and fell to the earth and worshipped;
content_old: 20 Then Job arose､ and rent his robe, and shaved his head, and fell to the earth and worshipped;

content: 21 and said— Naked came I forth from the womb of my mother､ And naked must I return thither, Yahweh gave, and Yahweh hath taken away,— The name of Yahweh be blessed!
content_old: 21 and said— Naked came I forth from the womb of my mother､ And naked must I return thither, Yahweh gave, and Yahweh hath taken away,— The name of Yahweh be blessed!

content: 1 And there came a certain day when the sons of God entered in, to present themselves unto Yahweh,—so the accuser also entered in their midst, to present himself unto Yahweh.
content_old: 1 And there came a certain day when the sons of God entered in, to present themselves unto Yahweh,—so the accuser also entered in their midst, to present himself unto Yahweh.

content: 2 And Yahweh said unto the accuser, Whence comest thou? And the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from wandering about therein.
content_old: 2 And Yahweh said unto the accuser, Whence comest thou? And the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from wandering about therein.

content: 3 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Hast thou applied thy heart unto my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth､ a man blameless and upright､ one who revereth God､ and avoideth evil; and still he is holding fast his integrity, although thou movedst me against him､ to swallow him up without cause.
content_old: 3 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Hast thou applied thy heart unto my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth､ a man blameless and upright､ one who revereth God､ and avoideth evil; and still he is holding fast his integrity, although thou movedst me against him､ to swallow him up without cause.

content: 4 Then the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, Skin for skin､ and so all that a man hath will he give for his life.
content_old: 4 Then the accuser answered Yahweh､ and said, Skin for skin､ and so all that a man hath will he give for his life.

content: 5 In very deed put forth､ I pray thee､ thy hand, and smite unto his bone､ and unto his flesh,—verily unto thy face will he curse thee.
content_old: 5 In very deed put forth､ I pray thee､ thy hand, and smite unto his bone､ and unto his flesh,—verily unto thy face will he curse thee.

content: 6 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Behold him! in thy hand,—only his life preserve thou!
content_old: 6 And Yahweh said unto the accuser､ Behold him! in thy hand,—only his life preserve thou!

content: 7 So the accuser went forth from the presence of Yahweh,—and smote Job with a sore boil, from the sole of his foot､ unto his crown.
content_old: 7 So the accuser went forth from the presence of Yahweh,—and smote Job with a sore boil, from the sole of his foot､ unto his crown.

content: 8 And he took him a potsherd, to scrape himself therewith; he being seated in the midst of ashes.
content_old: 8 And he took him a potsherd, to scrape himself therewith; he being seated in the midst of ashes.

content: 9 Then said his wife unto him, Art thou still holding fast thine integrity? Curse God､ and die!
content_old: 9 Then said his wife unto him, Art thou still holding fast thine integrity? Curse God､ and die!

content: 10 And he said unto her､ As one of the base women speaketh speakest thou? Blessing shall we accept from God, and misfortune shall we not accept? In all this Job sinned not with his lips.
content_old: 10 And he said unto her､ As one of the base women speaketh speakest thou? Blessing shall we accept from God, and misfortune shall we not accept? In all this Job sinned not with his lips.

content: 11 Now when the three friends of Job heard of all this misfortune which had befallen him,—they came､ every man from his own place, Eliphaz the Temanite､ and Bildad the Shuhite､ and Zophar the Naamathite,—for they had by appointment met together to come to shew sympathy with him､ and to comfort him.
content_old: 11 Now when the three friends of Job heard of all this misfortune which had befallen him,—they came､ every man from his own place, Eliphaz the Temanite､ and Bildad the Shuhite､ and Zophar the Naamathite,—for they had by appointment met together to come to shew sympathy with him､ and to comfort him.

content: 12 And when they lifted up their eyes afar off､ and knew him not they lifted up their voice､ and wept,—and rent､ every one his robe, and sprinkled dust upon their heads､ toward the heavens.
content_old: 12 And when they lifted up their eyes afar off､ and knew him not they lifted up their voice､ and wept,—and rent､ every one his robe, and sprinkled dust upon their heads､ toward the heavens.

content: 1 After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
content_old: 1 After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.

content: 2 So then Job began､ and said:—
content_old: 2 So then Job began､ and said:—

content: 3 Perish the day wherein I was born, And the night it was said, Lo! a manchild!
content_old: 3 Perish the day wherein I was born, And the night it was said, Lo! a manchild!

content: 4 That day be it darkness,— Let not God enquire after it from above, May there shine upon it no clear beam:
content_old: 4 That day be it darkness,— Let not God enquire after it from above, May there shine upon it no clear beam:

content: 5 Let darkness and death-shade buy it back､ May there settle down upon it a cloud, Let a day’s dark eclipse cause it terror:
content_old: 5 Let darkness and death-shade buy it back､ May there settle down upon it a cloud, Let a day’s dark eclipse cause it terror:

content: 6 That night darkness take it,— May it not rejoice among the days of the year, Into the number of months let it not enter.
content_old: 6 That night darkness take it,— May it not rejoice among the days of the year, Into the number of months let it not enter.

content: 7 Lo! that night be it barren, Let no joyous shouting enter therein:
content_old: 7 Lo! that night be it barren, Let no joyous shouting enter therein:

content: 8 Let day-cursers denounce it, Those skilled in rousing the dragon of the sky:
content_old: 8 Let day-cursers denounce it, Those skilled in rousing the dragon of the sky:

content: 9 Darkened be the stars of its twilight,— Let it wait for light､ and there be none, Neither let it see the eyelashes of the dawn:—
content_old: 9 Darkened be the stars of its twilight,— Let it wait for light､ and there be none, Neither let it see the eyelashes of the dawn:—

content: 10 Because it closed not the doors of the womb wherein I was,— And so hid trouble from mine eyes.
content_old: 10 Because it closed not the doors of the womb wherein I was,— And so hid trouble from mine eyes.

content: 11 Wherefore in the womb did I not die? From the womb come forth and cease to breathe?
content_old: 11 Wherefore in the womb did I not die? From the womb come forth and cease to breathe?

content: 12 For what reason were there prepared for me—knees? And why—breasts､ that I might suck?
content_old: 12 For what reason were there prepared for me—knees? And why—breasts､ that I might suck?

content: 13 Surely at once had I lain down､ and been quiet, I had fallen asleep､ then had I been at rest:—
content_old: 13 Surely at once had I lain down､ and been quiet, I had fallen asleep､ then had I been at rest:—

content: 14 With kings､ and counsellors of the earth, Who had built them pyramids:
content_old: 14 With kings､ and counsellors of the earth, Who had built them pyramids:

content: 15 Or with rulers possessing gold,— Who had filled their houses with silver:
content_old: 15 Or with rulers possessing gold,— Who had filled their houses with silver:

content: 16 Or that like an untimely birth hidden away I had not come into being, Like infants that never saw light:
content_old: 16 Or that like an untimely birth hidden away I had not come into being, Like infants that never saw light:

content: 17 There the lawless cease from raging, And there the toil-worn are at rest:
content_old: 17 There the lawless cease from raging, And there the toil-worn are at rest:

content: 18 At once are prisoners at peace, They hear not the voice of a driver:
content_old: 18 At once are prisoners at peace, They hear not the voice of a driver:

content: 19 Small and great there they are, And the slave is free from his master.
content_old: 19 Small and great there they are, And the slave is free from his master.

content: 20 Wherefore give､ to the wretched､ light? Or life to the embittered in soul?—
content_old: 20 Wherefore give､ to the wretched､ light? Or life to the embittered in soul?—

content: 21 Who long for death､ and it is not, And have digged for it､ beyond hid treasures:
content_old: 21 Who long for death､ and it is not, And have digged for it､ beyond hid treasures:

content: 22 Who rejoice unto exultation, Are glad､ when they can find the grave:
content_old: 22 Who rejoice unto exultation, Are glad､ when they can find the grave:

content: 23 To a man､ whose way is concealed, And God hath straitly enclosed him?
content_old: 23 To a man､ whose way is concealed, And God hath straitly enclosed him?

content: 24 For in the face of my food my sighing cometh in, And poured out like the water are my groans:
content_old: 24 For in the face of my food my sighing cometh in, And poured out like the water are my groans:

content: 25 For a dread I dreaded､ and it hath come upon me, And that from which I shrank hath overtaken me.
content_old: 25 For a dread I dreaded､ and it hath come upon me, And that from which I shrank hath overtaken me.

content: 1 Then responded Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:—

content: 2 If one attempt a word unto thee wilt thou be impatient? But to restrain speech who can endure?
content_old: 2 If one attempt a word unto thee wilt thou be impatient? But to restrain speech who can endure?

content: 3 Lo! thou hast admonished many, And slack hands hast thou been wont to uphold:
content_old: 3 Lo! thou hast admonished many, And slack hands hast thou been wont to uphold:

content: 4 Him that was stumbling have thy words raised up, And sinking knees hast thou strengthened.
content_old: 4 Him that was stumbling have thy words raised up, And sinking knees hast thou strengthened.

content: 5 But now it cometh upon thee､ And thou despairest, It smiteth even thee, And thou art dismayed.
content_old: 5 But now it cometh upon thee､ And thou despairest, It smiteth even thee, And thou art dismayed.

content: 6 Is not thy reverence thy confidence? And is not thy hope the very integrity of thy ways?
content_old: 6 Is not thy reverence thy confidence? And is not thy hope the very integrity of thy ways?

content: 7 Remember､ I pray thee､ who being innocent hath perished, Or when the upright have been cut off.
content_old: 7 Remember､ I pray thee､ who being innocent hath perished, Or when the upright have been cut off.

content: 8 So far as I have seen They who plow for iniquity And sow misery､ Reap the same:
content_old: 8 So far as I have seen They who plow for iniquity And sow misery､ Reap the same:

content: 9 By the blast of God they perish, And by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed:
content_old: 9 By the blast of God they perish, And by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed:

content: 10 Notwithstanding the roaring of the lion､ and the noise of the howling lion Yet the teeth of the fierce lions are broken:
content_old: 10 Notwithstanding the roaring of the lion､ and the noise of the howling lion Yet the teeth of the fierce lions are broken:

content: 11 The strong lion perishing for lack of prey Even the whelps of the lioness are scattered.
content_old: 11 The strong lion perishing for lack of prey Even the whelps of the lioness are scattered.

content: 12 But unto me something was brought by stealth,— And mine ear caught a whispering of the same:
content_old: 12 But unto me something was brought by stealth,— And mine ear caught a whispering of the same:

content: 13 When there were thoughts､ from visions of the night,— When deep sleep falleth upon men
content_old: 13 When there were thoughts､ from visions of the night,— When deep sleep falleth upon men

content: 14 Dread came upon me､ and trembling, The multitude of my bones it put in dread:
content_old: 14 Dread came upon me､ and trembling, The multitude of my bones it put in dread:

content: 15 Then a spirit over my face floated along, The hair of my flesh bristled-up:
content_old: 15 Then a spirit over my face floated along, The hair of my flesh bristled-up:

content: 16 It stood still､ but I could not distinguish its appearance, I looked､ but there was no form before mine eyes,— A whispering voice I heard:—
content_old: 16 It stood still､ but I could not distinguish its appearance, I looked､ but there was no form before mine eyes,— A whispering voice I heard:—

content: 17 Shall mortal man be more just than God? Or a man be more pure than his Maker?
content_old: 17 Shall mortal man be more just than God? Or a man be more pure than his Maker?

content: 18 Lo! in his own servants he trusteth not, And his own messengers he chargeth with error:
content_old: 18 Lo! in his own servants he trusteth not, And his own messengers he chargeth with error:

content: 19 How much more the dwellers in houses of clay､ Which in the dust have their foundation, Which are crushed sooner than a moth:
content_old: 19 How much more the dwellers in houses of clay､ Which in the dust have their foundation, Which are crushed sooner than a moth:

content: 20 Betwixt morning and evening are they broken in pieces, With none to save they utterly perish:
content_old: 20 Betwixt morning and evening are they broken in pieces, With none to save they utterly perish:

content: 1 Call､ I pray thee—is there one to answer thee? Or to which of the holy ones wilt thou turn?
content_old: 1 Call､ I pray thee—is there one to answer thee? Or to which of the holy ones wilt thou turn?

content: 2 For to the foolish man death is caused by vexation, And the simple one is slain by jealousy.
content_old: 2 For to the foolish man death is caused by vexation, And the simple one is slain by jealousy.

content: 3 I have seen the foolish taking root, And then hath his home decayed in a moment:
content_old: 3 I have seen the foolish taking root, And then hath his home decayed in a moment:

content: 4 His children are far removed from safety, And they are crushed in the gate､ and there is none to deliver:
content_old: 4 His children are far removed from safety, And they are crushed in the gate､ and there is none to deliver:

content: 5 Whose harvest the hungry eateth up､ And even out of thorn hedges be taketh it, And the snare gapeth for their substance.
content_old: 5 Whose harvest the hungry eateth up､ And even out of thorn hedges be taketh it, And the snare gapeth for their substance.

content: 6 For sorrow cometh not forth out of the dust,— Nor out of the ground sprouteth trouble.
content_old: 6 For sorrow cometh not forth out of the dust,— Nor out of the ground sprouteth trouble.

content: 7 Though man to trouble were born, As sparks on high do soar
content_old: 7 Though man to trouble were born, As sparks on high do soar

content: 8 Yet indeed I would seek unto El, And unto Elohim would I set forth my cause:—
content_old: 8 Yet indeed I would seek unto El, And unto Elohim would I set forth my cause:—

content: 9 Who doeth great things､ beyond all search,— Wondrous things､ till they cannot be recounted;
content_old: 9 Who doeth great things､ beyond all search,— Wondrous things､ till they cannot be recounted;

content: 10 Who giveth rain､ upon the face of the earth, And sendeth forth waters､ over the face of the open fields;
content_old: 10 Who giveth rain､ upon the face of the earth, And sendeth forth waters､ over the face of the open fields;

content: 11 Setting the lowly on high, And mourners are uplifted to safety;
content_old: 11 Setting the lowly on high, And mourners are uplifted to safety;

content: 12 Who doth frustrate the schemes of the crafty, That their hands cannot achieve abiding success;
content_old: 12 Who doth frustrate the schemes of the crafty, That their hands cannot achieve abiding success;

content: 13 Who captureth the wise in their own craftiness, Yea the headlong counsel of the crooked:
content_old: 13 Who captureth the wise in their own craftiness, Yea the headlong counsel of the crooked:

content: 14 By day they encounter darkness, And as though it were night they grope at high noon.
content_old: 14 By day they encounter darkness, And as though it were night they grope at high noon.

content: 15 But he saveth from the sword､ out of their mouth, And out of the hand of the strong the needy.
content_old: 15 But he saveth from the sword､ out of their mouth, And out of the hand of the strong the needy.

content: 16 Thus to the poor hath come hope, And perversity hath shut her mouth.
content_old: 16 Thus to the poor hath come hope, And perversity hath shut her mouth.

content: 17 Lo! how happy is the man whom God correcteth! Therefore the chastening of the Almighty do not thou refuse;
content_old: 17 Lo! how happy is the man whom God correcteth! Therefore the chastening of the Almighty do not thou refuse;

content: 18 For he woundeth that he may bind up, He smiteth through､ that his own hands may heal.
content_old: 18 For he woundeth that he may bind up, He smiteth through､ that his own hands may heal.

content: 19 ln six troubles he will rescue thee, And in seven there shall smite thee no misfortune:
content_old: 19 ln six troubles he will rescue thee, And in seven there shall smite thee no misfortune:

content: 20 ln famine he will ransom thee from death, And in battle from the power of the sword;
content_old: 20 ln famine he will ransom thee from death, And in battle from the power of the sword;

content: 21 During the scourge of the tongue shalt thou be hid, Neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh;
content_old: 21 During the scourge of the tongue shalt thou be hid, Neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh;

content: 22 At destruction and at hunger shalt thou laugh, And of the wild beast of the earth be not thou afraid;
content_old: 22 At destruction and at hunger shalt thou laugh, And of the wild beast of the earth be not thou afraid;

content: 23 For with the stones of the field shall be thy covenant, And the wild beast of the field hath been made thy friend;
content_old: 23 For with the stones of the field shall be thy covenant, And the wild beast of the field hath been made thy friend;

content: 24 And thou shalt know that at peace is thy tent, And shalt visit thy fold､ and miss nothing;
content_old: 24 And thou shalt know that at peace is thy tent, And shalt visit thy fold､ and miss nothing;

content: 25 And thou shalt know､ that numerous is thy seed, And thine offspring like the young shoots of the field.
content_old: 25 And thou shalt know､ that numerous is thy seed, And thine offspring like the young shoots of the field.

content: 26 Thou shalt come､ yet robust､ to the grave, As a stack of sheaves mounteth up in its season.
content_old: 26 Thou shalt come､ yet robust､ to the grave, As a stack of sheaves mounteth up in its season.

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 Oh that weighed were my vexation, And my engulphing ruin—into the balances they would lift up all at once!
content_old: 2 Oh that weighed were my vexation, And my engulphing ruin—into the balances they would lift up all at once!

content: 3 For now beyond the sand of the seas would it be heavy, On this account my words have wandered.
content_old: 3 For now beyond the sand of the seas would it be heavy, On this account my words have wandered.

content: 4 For the arrows of the Almighty are in me､ The heat whereof my spirit is drinking up, The terrors of God array themselves against me.
content_old: 4 For the arrows of the Almighty are in me､ The heat whereof my spirit is drinking up, The terrors of God array themselves against me.

content: 5 Doth the wild ass bray over grass? Or loweth the ox over his fodder?
content_old: 5 Doth the wild ass bray over grass? Or loweth the ox over his fodder?

content: 6 Can that which hath no savour be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
content_old: 6 Can that which hath no savour be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

content: 7 My soul hath refused to touch, Those things are like disease in my food.
content_old: 7 My soul hath refused to touch, Those things are like disease in my food.

content: 8 Oh that my request would come! And my hope oh that God would grant!
content_old: 8 Oh that my request would come! And my hope oh that God would grant!

content: 9 That it would please God to crush me, That he would set free his hand､ and cut me off!
content_old: 9 That it would please God to crush me, That he would set free his hand､ and cut me off!

content: 10 So might it still be my comfort､ And I might exult in the anguish he would not spare,— That I had not concealed the sayings of the Holy One.
content_old: 10 So might it still be my comfort､ And I might exult in the anguish he would not spare,— That I had not concealed the sayings of the Holy One.

content: 11 What is my strength､ that I should hope? Or what mine end､ that I should prolong my desire?
content_old: 11 What is my strength､ that I should hope? Or what mine end､ that I should prolong my desire?

content: 12 Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of bronze?
content_old: 12 Is my strength the strength of stones? Or is my flesh of bronze?

content: 13 Is there any help at all in me? Is not abiding success driven from me?
content_old: 13 Is there any help at all in me? Is not abiding success driven from me?

content: 14 The despairing from his friend should have lovingkindness, Or the reverence of the Almighty he may forsake.
content_old: 14 The despairing from his friend should have lovingkindness, Or the reverence of the Almighty he may forsake.

content: 15 Mine own brethren have proved treacherous like a torrent, Like a channel of torrents which disappear:
content_old: 15 Mine own brethren have proved treacherous like a torrent, Like a channel of torrents which disappear:

content: 16 Which darken by reason of the cold, Over them is a covering made by the snow:
content_old: 16 Which darken by reason of the cold, Over them is a covering made by the snow:

content: 17 By the time they begin to thaw they are dried up, As soon as it is warm they have vanished out of their place.
content_old: 17 By the time they begin to thaw they are dried up, As soon as it is warm they have vanished out of their place.

content: 18 Caravans turn aside by their course, They go up into a waste､ and are lost:
content_old: 18 Caravans turn aside by their course, They go up into a waste､ and are lost:

content: 19 The caravans of Tema looked about, The travelling companies of Sheba hoped for them:
content_old: 19 The caravans of Tema looked about, The travelling companies of Sheba hoped for them:

content: 20 They are ashamed that they had trusted, They have come up to one of them､ and are confounded.
content_old: 20 They are ashamed that they had trusted, They have come up to one of them､ and are confounded.

content: 21 For now ye have come to him, Ye see something fearful､ and fear.
content_old: 21 For now ye have come to him, Ye see something fearful､ and fear.

content: 22 Is it that I said､ Make me a gift, Or out of your abundance offer a bribe on my behalf;
content_old: 22 Is it that I said､ Make me a gift, Or out of your abundance offer a bribe on my behalf;

content: 23 And deliver me from the hand of the adversary? And out of the hand of tyrants ransom me?
content_old: 23 And deliver me from the hand of the adversary? And out of the hand of tyrants ransom me?

content: 24 Shew me､ and I will hold my peace, And wherein I have erred cause me to understand.
content_old: 24 Shew me､ and I will hold my peace, And wherein I have erred cause me to understand.

content: 25 How pleasant are the sayings that are right! But what can a decision from you decide?
content_old: 25 How pleasant are the sayings that are right! But what can a decision from you decide?

content: 26 To decide words do ye intend, When to the wind are spoken the sayings of one in despair?
content_old: 26 To decide words do ye intend, When to the wind are spoken the sayings of one in despair?

content: 27 Surely the fatherless ye would assail, And make merchandise of your friend!
content_old: 27 Surely the fatherless ye would assail, And make merchandise of your friend!

content: 28 But now be pleased to turn to me, That it may be to your faces if I speak falsehood,
content_old: 28 But now be pleased to turn to me, That it may be to your faces if I speak falsehood,

content: 29 Reply､ I pray you､ let there be no perversity, Yea reply even yet､ my vindication is in it!
content_old: 29 Reply､ I pray you､ let there be no perversity, Yea reply even yet､ my vindication is in it!

content: 1 Is there not a warfare to a mortal､ upon earth? And as the days of a hireling are not his days?
content_old: 1 Is there not a warfare to a mortal､ upon earth? And as the days of a hireling are not his days?

content: 2 As a bondman panteth for the shadow､ And as a hireling longeth for his wage
content_old: 2 As a bondman panteth for the shadow､ And as a hireling longeth for his wage

content: 3 So have I been made to inherit months of calamity, And nights of weariness have been appointed me.
content_old: 3 So have I been made to inherit months of calamity, And nights of weariness have been appointed me.

content: 4 As soon as I lie down I say､ When shall I arise? yet he lengtheneth out the evening, And I am wearied with tossings until the breeze of twilight.
content_old: 4 As soon as I lie down I say､ When shall I arise? yet he lengtheneth out the evening, And I am wearied with tossings until the breeze of twilight.

content: 5 My flesh is clothed with worms and a coating of dust, My skin hath hardened, and then run afresh:
content_old: 5 My flesh is clothed with worms and a coating of dust, My skin hath hardened, and then run afresh:

content: 6 My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, And they are spent､ without hope.
content_old: 6 My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, And they are spent､ without hope.

content: 7 Remember thou､ that a wind is my life, Not again shall mine eye see blessing:
content_old: 7 Remember thou､ that a wind is my life, Not again shall mine eye see blessing:

content: 8 Nor shall see me—the eye that used to behold me, Thine eyes are upon me､ and I am not.
content_old: 8 Nor shall see me—the eye that used to behold me, Thine eyes are upon me､ and I am not.

content: 9 A cloud faileth､ and is gone, So he that descendeth to hades､ shall not come up:
content_old: 9 A cloud faileth､ and is gone, So he that descendeth to hades､ shall not come up:

content: 10 He shall not return again to his house, And his own place shall be acquainted with him no more.
content_old: 10 He shall not return again to his house, And his own place shall be acquainted with him no more.

content: 11 I also cannot restrain my mouth,— I must speak､ in the anguish of my spirit, I must find utterance､ in the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 11 I also cannot restrain my mouth,— I must speak､ in the anguish of my spirit, I must find utterance､ in the bitterness of my soul.

content: 12 Am I a sea､ or a sea-monster,— That thou shouldst set over me a watch?
content_old: 12 Am I a sea､ or a sea-monster,— That thou shouldst set over me a watch?

content: 13 When I say､ My bed shall comfort me, My couch shall help to carry my complaint
content_old: 13 When I say､ My bed shall comfort me, My couch shall help to carry my complaint

content: 14 Then thou scarest me with dreams, And by visions dost thou terrify me:
content_old: 14 Then thou scarest me with dreams, And by visions dost thou terrify me:

content: 15 So that my soul chooseth strangling, Death rather than these my bones!
content_old: 15 So that my soul chooseth strangling, Death rather than these my bones!

content: 16 I am wasted away､ Not to times age-abiding can I live, Let me alone, For a breath are my days.
content_old: 16 I am wasted away､ Not to times age-abiding can I live, Let me alone, For a breath are my days.

content: 17 What is a mortal､ That thou shouldst nurture him? Or that thou shouldst fix upon him thy mind?
content_old: 17 What is a mortal､ That thou shouldst nurture him? Or that thou shouldst fix upon him thy mind?

content: 18 That thou shouldst inspect him morning by morning, Moment by moment shouldst test him?
content_old: 18 That thou shouldst inspect him morning by morning, Moment by moment shouldst test him?

content: 19 How long wilt thou not look away from me? Wilt thou not let me alone､ till I can swallow my spittle?
content_old: 19 How long wilt thou not look away from me? Wilt thou not let me alone､ till I can swallow my spittle?

content: 20 I have sinned､ What can I do for thee､ thou watcher of men? Wherefore hast thou set me as thine object of attack, Or have I become､ unto thee､ a burden?
content_old: 20 I have sinned､ What can I do for thee､ thou watcher of men? Wherefore hast thou set me as thine object of attack, Or have I become､ unto thee､ a burden?

content: 1 Then responded Bildad the Shuhite, and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Bildad the Shuhite, and said:—

content: 2 How long wilt thou speak these things? Or as a mighty wind shall be the sayings of thy mouth?
content_old: 2 How long wilt thou speak these things? Or as a mighty wind shall be the sayings of thy mouth?

content: 3 Should GOD pervert justice? Or the Almighty pervert righteousness?
content_old: 3 Should GOD pervert justice? Or the Almighty pervert righteousness?

content: 4 Though thy children sinned against him, And he delivered them into the hand of their transgression
content_old: 4 Though thy children sinned against him, And he delivered them into the hand of their transgression

content: 5 Yet if thou thyself wilt diligently seek unto GOD,— And unto the Almighty wilt make supplication;
content_old: 5 Yet if thou thyself wilt diligently seek unto GOD,— And unto the Almighty wilt make supplication;

content: 6 If pure and upright thou thyself art Surely now will he answer thy prayer, And will prosper thy righteous habitation:
content_old: 6 If pure and upright thou thyself art Surely now will he answer thy prayer, And will prosper thy righteous habitation:

content: 7 So shall thy beginning appear small,— When thy latter end he shall greatly increase!
content_old: 7 So shall thy beginning appear small,— When thy latter end he shall greatly increase!

content: 8 For inquire､ I pray thee､ of a former generation, And prepare thyself for the research of their fathers;—
content_old: 8 For inquire､ I pray thee､ of a former generation, And prepare thyself for the research of their fathers;—

content: 9 For of yesterday are we､ and cannot know, For a shadow are our days upon earth:
content_old: 9 For of yesterday are we､ and cannot know, For a shadow are our days upon earth:

content: 10 Shall they not teach thee—tell thee, And out of their memory bring forth words?
content_old: 10 Shall they not teach thee—tell thee, And out of their memory bring forth words?

content: 11 Can the paper-reed grow up､ without a marsh? Or the rush grow up､ without water?
content_old: 11 Can the paper-reed grow up､ without a marsh? Or the rush grow up､ without water?

content: 12 Though while still in its freshness it be not plucked off Yet before any kind of grass it doth wither:
content_old: 12 Though while still in its freshness it be not plucked off Yet before any kind of grass it doth wither:

content: 13 So shall be the latter end of all who forget GOD, And the hope of the impious shall perish:
content_old: 13 So shall be the latter end of all who forget GOD, And the hope of the impious shall perish:

content: 14 Whose trust shall be contemptible,— And a spider’s web his confidence:
content_old: 14 Whose trust shall be contemptible,— And a spider’s web his confidence:

content: 15 He leaneth upon his house､ and it will not stand, He holdeth it fast､ and it will not remain erect.
content_old: 15 He leaneth upon his house､ and it will not stand, He holdeth it fast､ and it will not remain erect.

content: 16 Full of moisture he is､ before the sun, And over his garden his shoot goeth forth:
content_old: 16 Full of moisture he is､ before the sun, And over his garden his shoot goeth forth:

content: 17 Over a heap his roots are entwined, A place of stones he descrieth;
content_old: 17 Over a heap his roots are entwined, A place of stones he descrieth;

content: 18 lf one destroy him out of his place Then will it disown him saying— I have not seen thee.
content_old: 18 lf one destroy him out of his place Then will it disown him saying— I have not seen thee.

content: 19 Lo! that is the joy of his way,— And out of the dust shall others spring up.
content_old: 19 Lo! that is the joy of his way,— And out of the dust shall others spring up.

content: 20 Lo! GOD will not reject a blameless man, Neither will he grasp the hand of evil-doers:
content_old: 20 Lo! GOD will not reject a blameless man, Neither will he grasp the hand of evil-doers:

content: 21 At length he shall fill with laughter thy mouth, And thy lips､ with a shout of triumph:
content_old: 21 At length he shall fill with laughter thy mouth, And thy lips､ with a shout of triumph:

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said—

content: 2 Of a truth I know that so it is, But how can a mortal be just with GOD?
content_old: 2 Of a truth I know that so it is, But how can a mortal be just with GOD?

content: 3 If he choose to contend with him He cannot answer him､ one of a thousand:
content_old: 3 If he choose to contend with him He cannot answer him､ one of a thousand:

content: 4 Wise in heart､ and alert in vigour What man hath hardened himself against him､ and prospered!
content_old: 4 Wise in heart､ and alert in vigour What man hath hardened himself against him､ and prospered!

content: 5 Who removeth mountains､ unawares, Who overturneth them in his anger;
content_old: 5 Who removeth mountains､ unawares, Who overturneth them in his anger;

content: 6 Who shaketh the earth､ out of its place, And the pillars thereof shudder;
content_old: 6 Who shaketh the earth､ out of its place, And the pillars thereof shudder;

content: 7 Who commandeth the sun､ and it breaketh not forth, And about the stars he putteth a seal;
content_old: 7 Who commandeth the sun､ and it breaketh not forth, And about the stars he putteth a seal;

content: 8 Who spreadeth out the heavens､ by himself alone! And marcheth along､ on the heights of the sea;
content_old: 8 Who spreadeth out the heavens､ by himself alone! And marcheth along､ on the heights of the sea;

content: 9 Who made the Bear､ the Giant and the Cluster, And the chambers of the south;
content_old: 9 Who made the Bear､ the Giant and the Cluster, And the chambers of the south;

content: 10 Who doeth great things､ past finding out, And marvels､ beyond number.
content_old: 10 Who doeth great things､ past finding out, And marvels､ beyond number.

content: 11 Lo! he cometh upon me､ yet can I not see him, Yea he passeth on, yet can I not discern him.
content_old: 11 Lo! he cometh upon me､ yet can I not see him, Yea he passeth on, yet can I not discern him.

content: 12 Lo! he snatcheth away､ who can bring it back? Who shall say unto him､ What wouldst thou do?
content_old: 12 Lo! he snatcheth away､ who can bring it back? Who shall say unto him､ What wouldst thou do?

content: 13 As for God if he withdraw not his anger Under him will have submitted themselves—the proud helpers.
content_old: 13 As for God if he withdraw not his anger Under him will have submitted themselves—the proud helpers.

content: 14 How much less that I should answer him, Should choose my words with him?
content_old: 14 How much less that I should answer him, Should choose my words with him?

content: 15 Whom though I were righteous yet would I not answer, To be absolved I would make supplication.
content_old: 15 Whom though I were righteous yet would I not answer, To be absolved I would make supplication.

content: 16 Though I had called､ and he had answered me I could not believe､ that he would lend an ear to my voice.
content_old: 16 Though I had called､ and he had answered me I could not believe､ that he would lend an ear to my voice.

content: 17 For with a tempest would he fall upon me, And would multiply my wounds without need;
content_old: 17 For with a tempest would he fall upon me, And would multiply my wounds without need;

content: 18 He would not suffer me to recover my breath, For he would surfeit me with bitter things.
content_old: 18 He would not suffer me to recover my breath, For he would surfeit me with bitter things.

content: 19 If it regardeth vigour bold is he! If justice who could summon him?
content_old: 19 If it regardeth vigour bold is he! If justice who could summon him?

content: 20 If I should justify myself mine own mouth would condemn me,— I blameless? then had it shewn me perverse.
content_old: 20 If I should justify myself mine own mouth would condemn me,— I blameless? then had it shewn me perverse.

content: 21 I blameless? I should not know my own soul､ I should despise my own life!
content_old: 21 I blameless? I should not know my own soul､ I should despise my own life!

content: 22 One thing there is､ for which cause I have said it, The blameless and the lawless he bringeth to an end.
content_old: 22 One thing there is､ for which cause I have said it, The blameless and the lawless he bringeth to an end.

content: 23 If a scourge slay suddenly At the despair of innocent ones he mocketh.
content_old: 23 If a scourge slay suddenly At the despair of innocent ones he mocketh.

content: 24 The earth hath been given into the hand of a lawless one､ The faces of her judges he covereth, If not then who is it?
content_old: 24 The earth hath been given into the hand of a lawless one､ The faces of her judges he covereth, If not then who is it?

content: 25 My days therefore､ are swifter than a runner, They have fled､ they have seen no good.
content_old: 25 My days therefore､ are swifter than a runner, They have fled､ they have seen no good.

content: 26 They have passed away with boats of paper-reed, Like a vulture which rusheth upon food.
content_old: 26 They have passed away with boats of paper-reed, Like a vulture which rusheth upon food.

content: 27 If I say､ I will forget my complaint, I will lay aside my sad countenance､ and brighten up
content_old: 27 If I say､ I will forget my complaint, I will lay aside my sad countenance､ and brighten up

content: 28 I am afraid of all my pains, I know､ that thou wilt not pronounce me innocent.
content_old: 28 I am afraid of all my pains, I know､ that thou wilt not pronounce me innocent.

content: 29 I shall be held guilty,— Wherefore then in vain should I toil?
content_old: 29 I shall be held guilty,— Wherefore then in vain should I toil?

content: 30 Though I bathe myself in snow water, And cleanse､ in cleanness itself､ my hands
content_old: 30 Though I bathe myself in snow water, And cleanse､ in cleanness itself､ my hands

content: 31 Then in a ditch wouldst thou plunge me, And mine own clothes should abhor me:
content_old: 31 Then in a ditch wouldst thou plunge me, And mine own clothes should abhor me:

content: 32 For he is not a man like myself､ whom I might answer, Nor could we come together into judgment:
content_old: 32 For he is not a man like myself､ whom I might answer, Nor could we come together into judgment:

content: 33 There is not､ between us､ a mediator, Who might lay his hand upon us both.
content_old: 33 There is not､ between us､ a mediator, Who might lay his hand upon us both.

content: 34 Let him take from off me his rod, And his terror let it not startle me:
content_old: 34 Let him take from off me his rod, And his terror let it not startle me:

content: 1 My soul doth loathe my life,— I let loose my complaint, I speak､ in the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 1 My soul doth loathe my life,— I let loose my complaint, I speak､ in the bitterness of my soul.

content: 2 I say unto God､ Do not hold me guilty, Let me know､ on what account thou contendest with me!
content_old: 2 I say unto God､ Do not hold me guilty, Let me know､ on what account thou contendest with me!

content: 3 Is it seemly in thee､ that thou shouldst oppress? That thou shouldst despise the labour of thine own hand, When upon the counsel of the lawless thou hast shone?
content_old: 3 Is it seemly in thee､ that thou shouldst oppress? That thou shouldst despise the labour of thine own hand, When upon the counsel of the lawless thou hast shone?

content: 4 Eyes of flesh hast thou? Or as a mortal seeth seest thou?
content_old: 4 Eyes of flesh hast thou? Or as a mortal seeth seest thou?

content: 5 As the days of a mortal are thy days? Or thy years as the days of a man?
content_old: 5 As the days of a mortal are thy days? Or thy years as the days of a man?

content: 6 That thou shouldst seek for mine iniquity, And for my sin shouldst make search:
content_old: 6 That thou shouldst seek for mine iniquity, And for my sin shouldst make search:

content: 7 Though it is within thine own knowledge that I would not be lawless, And none out of thy hand can deliver?
content_old: 7 Though it is within thine own knowledge that I would not be lawless, And none out of thy hand can deliver?

content: 8 Thine own hands shaped me､ and made me, All in unison round about, and yet thou hast confounded me.
content_old: 8 Thine own hands shaped me､ and made me, All in unison round about, and yet thou hast confounded me.

content: 9 Remember､ I pray thee､ that as clay thou didst make me, And unto dust thou wilt cause me to return.
content_old: 9 Remember､ I pray thee､ that as clay thou didst make me, And unto dust thou wilt cause me to return.

content: 10 Didst thou not､ like milk pour me forth? And as cheese curdle me?
content_old: 10 Didst thou not､ like milk pour me forth? And as cheese curdle me?

content: 11 With skin and flesh clothe me? And with bones and sinews interweave me?
content_old: 11 With skin and flesh clothe me? And with bones and sinews interweave me?

content: 12 Life and lovingkindness thou didst bestow upon me,— And thy watchful care preserved my breath.
content_old: 12 Life and lovingkindness thou didst bestow upon me,— And thy watchful care preserved my breath.

content: 13 Yet these things thou didst hide in thy heart, I know､ that this hath been with thee!
content_old: 13 Yet these things thou didst hide in thy heart, I know､ that this hath been with thee!

content: 14 lf I have sinned then couldst thou watch me, And from mine iniquity thou wouldst not acquit me:
content_old: 14 lf I have sinned then couldst thou watch me, And from mine iniquity thou wouldst not acquit me:

content: 15 lf I have been lawless alas for me! Or if I am righteous I will not lift up my head, Surfeited with shame look thou then on my humiliation.
content_old: 15 lf I have been lawless alas for me! Or if I am righteous I will not lift up my head, Surfeited with shame look thou then on my humiliation.

content: 16 When it is lifted up like a howling lion thou dost hunt me, Then again thou dost shew thyself marvellous against me.
content_old: 16 When it is lifted up like a howling lion thou dost hunt me, Then again thou dost shew thyself marvellous against me.

content: 17 Thou renewest thy witnesses before me､ And dost increase thy vexation with me, Relays—yea an army is with me.
content_old: 17 Thou renewest thy witnesses before me､ And dost increase thy vexation with me, Relays—yea an army is with me.

content: 18 Wherefore then from the womb didst thou bring me forth? I might have breathed my last､ and no eye have seen me.
content_old: 18 Wherefore then from the womb didst thou bring me forth? I might have breathed my last､ and no eye have seen me.

content: 19 As though I had not been should I have become,— From the womb to the grave might I have been borne.
content_old: 19 As though I had not been should I have become,— From the womb to the grave might I have been borne.

content: 20 Are not my days few?—then forbear, And set me aside､ that I may brighten up for a little;
content_old: 20 Are not my days few?—then forbear, And set me aside､ that I may brighten up for a little;

content: 21 Before I go､ and not return, Unto a land of darkness and death-shade:
content_old: 21 Before I go､ and not return, Unto a land of darkness and death-shade:

content: 1 Then responded Zophar the Naamathite､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Zophar the Naamathite､ and said:—

content: 2 Should the multitude of words not be answered? Or should a man full of talk be justified?
content_old: 2 Should the multitude of words not be answered? Or should a man full of talk be justified?

content: 3 Shall thy pratings cause men to hold their peace? When thou hast mocked shall there be none to put thee to shame?
content_old: 3 Shall thy pratings cause men to hold their peace? When thou hast mocked shall there be none to put thee to shame?

content: 4 Since thou hast said､ Right is my doctrine, And pure am I in his eyes.
content_old: 4 Since thou hast said､ Right is my doctrine, And pure am I in his eyes.

content: 5 But in very deed oh that God would speak, That he would open his lips with thee:
content_old: 5 But in very deed oh that God would speak, That he would open his lips with thee:

content: 6 That he would declare to thee the secrets of wisdom､ For they are double to that which actually is,— Know then that God could bring into forgetfulness for thee､ a portion of thine iniquity.
content_old: 6 That he would declare to thee the secrets of wisdom､ For they are double to that which actually is,— Know then that God could bring into forgetfulness for thee､ a portion of thine iniquity.

content: 7 The hidden depth of God canst thou discover? Or unto the furthest limit of the Almighty canst thou attain?
content_old: 7 The hidden depth of God canst thou discover? Or unto the furthest limit of the Almighty canst thou attain?

content: 8 The heights of the heavens what canst thou do? Depths deeper than hades what canst thou know?
content_old: 8 The heights of the heavens what canst thou do? Depths deeper than hades what canst thou know?

content: 9 Longer than the earth is the measure thereof, And broader than the sea.
content_old: 9 Longer than the earth is the measure thereof, And broader than the sea.

content: 10 lf he sweep on､ or shut up､ or call together Who then shall hinder him?
content_old: 10 lf he sweep on､ or shut up､ or call together Who then shall hinder him?

content: 11 For he knoweth men of falsity､ And seeth iniquity､ and him that doth not diligently consider.
content_old: 11 For he knoweth men of falsity､ And seeth iniquity､ and him that doth not diligently consider.

content: 12 But an empty person will get sense, When a wild ass’s colt is born a man!
content_old: 12 But an empty person will get sense, When a wild ass’s colt is born a man!

content: 13 If thou hast prepared thy heart, And wilt spread forth､ unto him､ thy hands—
content_old: 13 If thou hast prepared thy heart, And wilt spread forth､ unto him､ thy hands—

content: 14 lf iniquity be in thy hand Put it far away, And let there not dwell in thy tents perversity
content_old: 14 lf iniquity be in thy hand Put it far away, And let there not dwell in thy tents perversity

content: 15 Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face free from blemish, And shalt be established､ and not fear.
content_old: 15 Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face free from blemish, And shalt be established､ and not fear.

content: 16 For now shalt thou forget sorrow, Like waters passed away shalt thou remember it.
content_old: 16 For now shalt thou forget sorrow, Like waters passed away shalt thou remember it.

content: 17 Above high noon shall rise life’s continuance, Darkness like a morning shall appear,
content_old: 17 Above high noon shall rise life’s continuance, Darkness like a morning shall appear,

content: 18 And thou shalt be confident､ that there is hope, And when thou hast searched securely shalt thou lie down;
content_old: 18 And thou shalt be confident､ that there is hope, And when thou hast searched securely shalt thou lie down;

content: 19 And shalt rest､ with none to put thee in terror,— And many shall entreat thy favour.
content_old: 19 And shalt rest､ with none to put thee in terror,— And many shall entreat thy favour.

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 Of a truth ye are the people, And with you wisdom will die.
content_old: 2 Of a truth ye are the people, And with you wisdom will die.

content: 3 I also have a mind like you､ I fall not short of you, But who hath not such things as these?
content_old: 3 I also have a mind like you､ I fall not short of you, But who hath not such things as these?

content: 4 A laughing-stock to one’s neighbour do I become､ One who hath called upon God and he hath answered him! A laughing-stock—a righteous man without blame!
content_old: 4 A laughing-stock to one’s neighbour do I become､ One who hath called upon God and he hath answered him! A laughing-stock—a righteous man without blame!

content: 5 For ruin there is contempt､ in the thought of the man at ease,— Ready, for such as are of faltering foot!
content_old: 5 For ruin there is contempt､ in the thought of the man at ease,— Ready, for such as are of faltering foot!

content: 6 At peace､ are the tents that belong to the spoilers､ And there is security to them who provoke GOD, To him who bringeth a God in his hand.
content_old: 6 At peace､ are the tents that belong to the spoilers､ And there is security to them who provoke GOD, To him who bringeth a God in his hand.

content: 7 But in very deed ask､ I pray thee､ the beasts､ and they will teach thee, And the bird of the heavens､ and it will tell thee;
content_old: 7 But in very deed ask､ I pray thee､ the beasts､ and they will teach thee, And the bird of the heavens､ and it will tell thee;

content: 8 Or address the earth､ and it will teach thee, And the fishes of the sea will recount it to thee:
content_old: 8 Or address the earth､ and it will teach thee, And the fishes of the sea will recount it to thee:

content: 9 Who knoweth not､ among all these, That the hand of Yahweh hath done this?
content_old: 9 Who knoweth not､ among all these, That the hand of Yahweh hath done this?

content: 10 In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, And the spirit of all the flesh of men.
content_old: 10 In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, And the spirit of all the flesh of men.

content: 11 Doth not the ear try words? Even as the palate tasteth for itself food?
content_old: 11 Doth not the ear try words? Even as the palate tasteth for itself food?

content: 12 ln the Ancient is wisdom, And in Length of Days understanding:
content_old: 12 ln the Ancient is wisdom, And in Length of Days understanding:

content: 13 With Him are wisdom and strength, To Him pertain counsel and understanding.
content_old: 13 With Him are wisdom and strength, To Him pertain counsel and understanding.

content: 14 Lo! He pulleth down､ and it cannot be built, He closeth up over a man､ and it cannot be opened:
content_old: 14 Lo! He pulleth down､ and it cannot be built, He closeth up over a man､ and it cannot be opened:

content: 15 Lo! He holdeth back the waters､ and they dry up, Or sendeth them out､ and they transform the earth:
content_old: 15 Lo! He holdeth back the waters､ and they dry up, Or sendeth them out､ and they transform the earth:

content: 16 With Him is strength and effective wisdom, To Him belong he that erreth､ and he that causeth to err.
content_old: 16 With Him is strength and effective wisdom, To Him belong he that erreth､ and he that causeth to err.

content: 17 Who leadeth away counsellors as a spoil, And judges He befooleth:
content_old: 17 Who leadeth away counsellors as a spoil, And judges He befooleth:

content: 18 The fetters of kings He looseth, Or hath bound a slave’s waistcloth about their loins:
content_old: 18 The fetters of kings He looseth, Or hath bound a slave’s waistcloth about their loins:

content: 19 Who leadeth away priests as a spoil, And men firmly seated He overturneth:
content_old: 19 Who leadeth away priests as a spoil, And men firmly seated He overturneth:

content: 20 Setting aside the speech of the trusty, And the discernment of elders He taketh away:
content_old: 20 Setting aside the speech of the trusty, And the discernment of elders He taketh away:

content: 21 Pouring contempt upon nobles, And the girdle of the mighty hath He loosed:
content_old: 21 Pouring contempt upon nobles, And the girdle of the mighty hath He loosed:

content: 22 Laying open deep things､ out of darkness, And bringing out to light､ the death-shade:
content_old: 22 Laying open deep things､ out of darkness, And bringing out to light､ the death-shade:

content: 23 Who giveth greatness to nations､ or destroyeth them, Who spreadeth out nations､ or leadeth them into exile:
content_old: 23 Who giveth greatness to nations､ or destroyeth them, Who spreadeth out nations､ or leadeth them into exile:

content: 24 Who taketh away the sense of the chiefs of the people of the earth, And hath caused them to wander in a pathless waste:
content_old: 24 Who taketh away the sense of the chiefs of the people of the earth, And hath caused them to wander in a pathless waste:

content: 1 Lo! all this hath mine own eye seen,—Mine ear hath heard and understood it:
content_old: 1 Lo! all this hath mine own eye seen,—Mine ear hath heard and understood it:

content: 2 Just as ye know I too know, I fall not short of you.
content_old: 2 Just as ye know I too know, I fall not short of you.

content: 3 But indeed I unto the Almighty would speak, And to direct my argument unto GOD would I be well pleased.
content_old: 3 But indeed I unto the Almighty would speak, And to direct my argument unto GOD would I be well pleased.

content: 4 For in truth ye do besmear with falsehood, Worthless physicians､ all of you!
content_old: 4 For in truth ye do besmear with falsehood, Worthless physicians､ all of you!

content: 5 Oh that ye would altogether hold your peace, And it should serve you for wisdom!
content_old: 5 Oh that ye would altogether hold your peace, And it should serve you for wisdom!

content: 6 Hear､ I pray you､ the argument of my mouth, And to the pleadings of my lips give heed:—
content_old: 6 Hear､ I pray you､ the argument of my mouth, And to the pleadings of my lips give heed:—

content: 7 Is it for GOD ye would speak perversely? And for him would ye speak deceit:
content_old: 7 Is it for GOD ye would speak perversely? And for him would ye speak deceit:

content: 8 Even for him would ye be partial? Or for GOD would ye so plead?
content_old: 8 Even for him would ye be partial? Or for GOD would ye so plead?

content: 9 Would it be well､ when he searched you out? Or as one might jest with a mortal would ye jest with him?
content_old: 9 Would it be well､ when he searched you out? Or as one might jest with a mortal would ye jest with him?

content: 10 He will severely rebuke you, If ye are secretly partial.
content_old: 10 He will severely rebuke you, If ye are secretly partial.

content: 11 Shall not his majesty overwhelm you? And the dread of him fall upon you?
content_old: 11 Shall not his majesty overwhelm you? And the dread of him fall upon you?

content: 12 Are not your memorable sayings､ proverbs of ashes? Breastworks of clay your breastworks?
content_old: 12 Are not your memorable sayings､ proverbs of ashes? Breastworks of clay your breastworks?

content: 13 Quietly let me alone､ that I may speak out, Then let come on me what may.
content_old: 13 Quietly let me alone､ that I may speak out, Then let come on me what may.

content: 14 ln any case I will take up my flesh in my teeth, And my life will I put in my hand:
content_old: 14 ln any case I will take up my flesh in my teeth, And my life will I put in my hand:

content: 15 Lo! he may slay me､ yet for him will I wait,— Nevertheless my ways—unto his face will I show to be right:
content_old: 15 Lo! he may slay me､ yet for him will I wait,— Nevertheless my ways—unto his face will I show to be right:

content: 16 Even he will be on my side—unto salvation, For not before his face shall any impious person come.
content_old: 16 Even he will be on my side—unto salvation, For not before his face shall any impious person come.

content: 17 Hear ye patiently my speech, And be my declaration in your ears.
content_old: 17 Hear ye patiently my speech, And be my declaration in your ears.

content: 18 Lo! I pray you､ I have set forth in order a plea, I know that I shall be found right.
content_old: 18 Lo! I pray you､ I have set forth in order a plea, I know that I shall be found right.

content: 19 Who is it that shall contend with me? For now if I should hold my peace why! I should breathe my last!
content_old: 19 Who is it that shall contend with me? For now if I should hold my peace why! I should breathe my last!

content: 20 Only two things do thou not with me, Then from thy face will I not hide me:—
content_old: 20 Only two things do thou not with me, Then from thy face will I not hide me:—

content: 21 Thy hand—from off me take thou far away, And thy terror let it not startle me!
content_old: 21 Thy hand—from off me take thou far away, And thy terror let it not startle me!

content: 22 Then call thou､ and I will answer, Or I will speak､ and reply thou unto me.
content_old: 22 Then call thou､ and I will answer, Or I will speak､ and reply thou unto me.

content: 23 How many are mine iniquities and sins? My transgression and my sin let me know!
content_old: 23 How many are mine iniquities and sins? My transgression and my sin let me know!

content: 24 Wherefore thy face shouldst thou hide? Or count me､ as an enemy to thee?
content_old: 24 Wherefore thy face shouldst thou hide? Or count me､ as an enemy to thee?

content: 25 A driven leaf wilt thou cause to tremble? Or dry stubble wilt thou pursue?
content_old: 25 A driven leaf wilt thou cause to tremble? Or dry stubble wilt thou pursue?

content: 26 For thou writest､ against me､ bitter things, And dost make me inherit the iniquities of my youth;
content_old: 26 For thou writest､ against me､ bitter things, And dost make me inherit the iniquities of my youth;

content: 27 And thou dost put—in the stocks—my feet､ And observest all my paths, Against the roots of my feet thou dost cut out a bound;
content_old: 27 And thou dost put—in the stocks—my feet､ And observest all my paths, Against the roots of my feet thou dost cut out a bound;

content: 1 Man that is born of a woman Is of few days､ and full of trouble:
content_old: 1 Man that is born of a woman Is of few days､ and full of trouble:

content: 2 As a flower he cometh forth—and fadeth, He fleeth also as a shadow､ and continueth not.
content_old: 2 As a flower he cometh forth—and fadeth, He fleeth also as a shadow､ and continueth not.

content: 3 And yet upon such a one as this hast thou opened thine eye? And him wouldst thou bring into judgment with thee?
content_old: 3 And yet upon such a one as this hast thou opened thine eye? And him wouldst thou bring into judgment with thee?

content: 4 Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? Not one!
content_old: 4 Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? Not one!

content: 5 If determined are his days the number of his months is with thee, Fixed times for him thou hast appointed and he cannot go beyond.
content_old: 5 If determined are his days the number of his months is with thee, Fixed times for him thou hast appointed and he cannot go beyond.

content: 6 Look away from him､ that he may rest, Till he shall pay off､ as a hireling､ his day.
content_old: 6 Look away from him､ that he may rest, Till he shall pay off､ as a hireling､ his day.

content: 7 Though there is—for a tree—hope,— If it should be cut down that again it will grow, And the tender branch thereof will not cease;
content_old: 7 Though there is—for a tree—hope,— If it should be cut down that again it will grow, And the tender branch thereof will not cease;

content: 8 If its root should become old in the earth, And in the dust its stock should die:
content_old: 8 If its root should become old in the earth, And in the dust its stock should die:

content: 9 Through the scent of water it may break forth, And produce branches like a sapling
content_old: 9 Through the scent of water it may break forth, And produce branches like a sapling

content: 10 Yet man dieth､ and is prostrate, Yea the son of earth doth cease to breathe､ and where is he?
content_old: 10 Yet man dieth､ and is prostrate, Yea the son of earth doth cease to breathe､ and where is he?

content: 11 Waters have failed from the sea, And a river may waste and dry up;
content_old: 11 Waters have failed from the sea, And a river may waste and dry up;

content: 12 So a man hath lain down､ and shall not arise,— Until there are no heavens they shall not awake, Nor be roused up out of their sleep.
content_old: 12 So a man hath lain down､ and shall not arise,— Until there are no heavens they shall not awake, Nor be roused up out of their sleep.

content: 13 Oh that in hades thou wouldst hide me! That thou wouldst keep me secret､ until the turn of thine anger, That thou wouldst set for me a fixed time､ and remember me:
content_old: 13 Oh that in hades thou wouldst hide me! That thou wouldst keep me secret､ until the turn of thine anger, That thou wouldst set for me a fixed time､ and remember me:

content: 14 If a man die can he live again? All the days of my warfare would I wait, Until my relief should come:—
content_old: 14 If a man die can he live again? All the days of my warfare would I wait, Until my relief should come:—

content: 15 Thou shouldst call､ and I would answer thee,— For the work of thine own hand thou shouldst long.
content_old: 15 Thou shouldst call､ and I would answer thee,— For the work of thine own hand thou shouldst long.

content: 16 For now my steps thou countest, Thou wilt not pass over my sin:
content_old: 16 For now my steps thou countest, Thou wilt not pass over my sin:

content: 17 Sealed up in a bag is my transgression, And thou hast glued over mine iniquity.
content_old: 17 Sealed up in a bag is my transgression, And thou hast glued over mine iniquity.

content: 18 But in very deed a mountain falling will lie prostrate, Or a rock moved out of its place:
content_old: 18 But in very deed a mountain falling will lie prostrate, Or a rock moved out of its place:

content: 19 Stones have heen hollowed out by waters､ The floods thereof wash away the dust of the earth, And the hope of mortal man thou hast destroyed:
content_old: 19 Stones have heen hollowed out by waters､ The floods thereof wash away the dust of the earth, And the hope of mortal man thou hast destroyed:

content: 20 Thou dost overpower him utterly､ and he departeth, Disfiguring his face so hast thou sent him away.
content_old: 20 Thou dost overpower him utterly､ and he departeth, Disfiguring his face so hast thou sent him away.

content: 21 His sons come to honour､ And he knoweth it､ not, Or they are brought low､ And he perceiveth it not of them.
content_old: 21 His sons come to honour､ And he knoweth it､ not, Or they are brought low､ And he perceiveth it not of them.

content: 1 Then responded Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:—

content: 2 Should a wise man answer unreal knowledge? Or fill､ with the east wind､ his inner man?
content_old: 2 Should a wise man answer unreal knowledge? Or fill､ with the east wind､ his inner man?

content: 3 Disputing with discourse that doth no good, Or with speech､ wherein is no profit?
content_old: 3 Disputing with discourse that doth no good, Or with speech､ wherein is no profit?

content: 4 But thoull wouldst take away reverence, And wouldst attain unto meditation before GOD.
content_old: 4 But thoull wouldst take away reverence, And wouldst attain unto meditation before GOD.

content: 5 For thine own mouth would teach thine iniquity, And thou wouldst choose the tongue of the crafty.
content_old: 5 For thine own mouth would teach thine iniquity, And thou wouldst choose the tongue of the crafty.

content: 6 Thine own mouth shall condemn thee､ and not I, And thine own lips shall testify against thee.
content_old: 6 Thine own mouth shall condemn thee､ and not I, And thine own lips shall testify against thee.

content: 7 The first of mankind wast thou born? Or before the hills wast thou brought forth?
content_old: 7 The first of mankind wast thou born? Or before the hills wast thou brought forth?

content: 8 In the secret council of God hast thou been wont to hearken? Or canst thou attain for thyself unto wisdom?
content_old: 8 In the secret council of God hast thou been wont to hearken? Or canst thou attain for thyself unto wisdom?

content: 9 What knowest thou､ that we know not? What understandest thou､ and the same is not with us?
content_old: 9 What knowest thou､ that we know not? What understandest thou､ and the same is not with us?

content: 10 Both hoary and venerable are among us, One mightier than thy father in days!
content_old: 10 Both hoary and venerable are among us, One mightier than thy father in days!

content: 11 Too small for thee are the consolations of GOD? Or a word spoken gently with thee?
content_old: 11 Too small for thee are the consolations of GOD? Or a word spoken gently with thee?

content: 12 How doth thine own heart carry thee away, And how thine eyes do roll!
content_old: 12 How doth thine own heart carry thee away, And how thine eyes do roll!

content: 13 For thy spirit replieth against God, And thou bringest forth—out of thy mouth—words!
content_old: 13 For thy spirit replieth against God, And thou bringest forth—out of thy mouth—words!

content: 14 What is a mortal､ that he should be pure? Or that righteous should be one born of a woman?
content_old: 14 What is a mortal､ that he should be pure? Or that righteous should be one born of a woman?

content: 15 Lo! in his holy ones he putteth not confidence, And the heavens are not pure in his eyes:
content_old: 15 Lo! in his holy ones he putteth not confidence, And the heavens are not pure in his eyes:

content: 16 How much less when one is detested and corrupt, A man who drinketh in—like water—perversity､
content_old: 16 How much less when one is detested and corrupt, A man who drinketh in—like water—perversity､

content: 17 I will tell thee—hear me, Since this I have seen I must needs declare it.
content_old: 17 I will tell thee—hear me, Since this I have seen I must needs declare it.

content: 18 Which wise men tell, And deny not that which is from their fathers.
content_old: 18 Which wise men tell, And deny not that which is from their fathers.

content: 19 To them alone was the earth given, And no alien passed through their midst:
content_old: 19 To them alone was the earth given, And no alien passed through their midst:

content: 20 All the days of the lawless manhe doth writhe with pain, And the number of years is hidden from the tyrant;
content_old: 20 All the days of the lawless manhe doth writhe with pain, And the number of years is hidden from the tyrant;

content: 21 A noise of dreadful things is in his ears, In prosperity the destroyer cometh upon him;
content_old: 21 A noise of dreadful things is in his ears, In prosperity the destroyer cometh upon him;

content: 22 He hath no confidence to come back out of darkness, He being destined to the power of the sword;
content_old: 22 He hath no confidence to come back out of darkness, He being destined to the power of the sword;

content: 23 A wanderer he､ for bread, saying Where is it? He knoweth that prepared by his own hand is the day of darkness;
content_old: 23 A wanderer he､ for bread, saying Where is it? He knoweth that prepared by his own hand is the day of darkness;

content: 24 Distress and anguish shall startle him, It shall overpower him､ like a king ready for the onset:
content_old: 24 Distress and anguish shall startle him, It shall overpower him､ like a king ready for the onset:

content: 25 Because he had stretched out—against GOD—his hand, And against the Almighty had been wont to behave himself proudly;
content_old: 25 Because he had stretched out—against GOD—his hand, And against the Almighty had been wont to behave himself proudly;

content: 26 He used to run against him with uplifted neck, With the stout bosses of his bucklers;
content_old: 26 He used to run against him with uplifted neck, With the stout bosses of his bucklers;

content: 27 For he had covered his face with his fatness, And had gathered a superabundance on his loins;
content_old: 27 For he had covered his face with his fatness, And had gathered a superabundance on his loins;

content: 28 And had inhabited demolished cities､ Houses wherein men would not dwell, That were destined to become heaps.
content_old: 28 And had inhabited demolished cities､ Houses wherein men would not dwell, That were destined to become heaps.

content: 29 He shall not be rich､ nor shall his substance continue, Neither shall their shadow stretch along on the earth;
content_old: 29 He shall not be rich､ nor shall his substance continue, Neither shall their shadow stretch along on the earth;

content: 30 He shall not depart out of darkness､ His young branch shall the flame dry up, And he shall depart､ by the breath of his own mouth!
content_old: 30 He shall not depart out of darkness､ His young branch shall the flame dry up, And he shall depart､ by the breath of his own mouth!

content: 31 Let no one trust in him that��by vanity—is deceived, For vanity shall be his recompense;
content_old: 31 Let no one trust in him that��by vanity—is deceived, For vanity shall be his recompense;

content: 32 Before his day shall it be accomplished, With his palm-top not covered with leaves;
content_old: 32 Before his day shall it be accomplished, With his palm-top not covered with leaves;

content: 33 He shall wrong—like a vine—his sour grapes, And shall cast off—as an olive-tree—his blossom.
content_old: 33 He shall wrong—like a vine—his sour grapes, And shall cast off—as an olive-tree—his blossom.

content: 34 For the family of the impious is unfruitful, And a fire hath devoured the tents of bribery;
content_old: 34 For the family of the impious is unfruitful, And a fire hath devoured the tents of bribery;

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 I have heard many such things, Wearisome comforters are ye all!
content_old: 2 I have heard many such things, Wearisome comforters are ye all!

content: 3 Is there to be an end to windy words? Or what so strongly exciteth thee､ that thou must respond?
content_old: 3 Is there to be an end to windy words? Or what so strongly exciteth thee､ that thou must respond?

content: 4 I also like you could speak,— If your soul were in the place of my soul I could string together words against you, And could therewith shake over you my head.
content_old: 4 I also like you could speak,— If your soul were in the place of my soul I could string together words against you, And could therewith shake over you my head.

content: 5 I could make you determined､ by my mouth, And then my lip-solace should restrain you.
content_old: 5 I could make you determined､ by my mouth, And then my lip-solace should restrain you.

content: 6 Though I do speak unassuaged is my stinging pain,— And if I forbear of what am I relieved?
content_old: 6 Though I do speak unassuaged is my stinging pain,— And if I forbear of what am I relieved?

content: 7 But now hath he wearied me, Thou hast destroyed all my family;
content_old: 7 But now hath he wearied me, Thou hast destroyed all my family;

content: 8 And having captured me it hath served as a witness; And so my wasting away hath risen up against me､ ln my face it answereth.
content_old: 8 And having captured me it hath served as a witness; And so my wasting away hath risen up against me､ ln my face it answereth.

content: 9 His anger hath torn and persecuted me､ He hath gnashed upon me with his teeth, Mine adversary hath sharpened his eyes for me.
