content_old: 9 His anger hath torn and persecuted me､ He hath gnashed upon me with his teeth, Mine adversary hath sharpened his eyes for me.

content: 10 They have gaped upon me with their mouth､ With reproach have they smitten my cheek, Together､ against me､ have they closed their ranks.
content_old: 10 They have gaped upon me with their mouth､ With reproach have they smitten my cheek, Together､ against me､ have they closed their ranks.

content: 11 GOD doth abandon me to him that is perverse, And into the hands of the lawless he throweth me headlong.
content_old: 11 GOD doth abandon me to him that is perverse, And into the hands of the lawless he throweth me headlong.

content: 12 At ease was I when he shattered me､ Yea he seized me by my neck､ and dashed me in pieces, Then set me up for himself as a mark:
content_old: 12 At ease was I when he shattered me､ Yea he seized me by my neck､ and dashed me in pieces, Then set me up for himself as a mark:

content: 13 His archers came round against me､ He clave asunder my reins､ and spared not, He poured out､ on the earth､ my gall:
content_old: 13 His archers came round against me､ He clave asunder my reins､ and spared not, He poured out､ on the earth､ my gall:

content: 14 He made a breach in me､ breach upon breach, He ran upon me､ like a mighty man.
content_old: 14 He made a breach in me､ breach upon breach, He ran upon me､ like a mighty man.

content: 15 Sackcloth sewed I on my skin, And rolled—in the dust—my horn:
content_old: 15 Sackcloth sewed I on my skin, And rolled—in the dust—my horn:

content: 16 My face is reddened from weeping, And upon mine eyelashes is the death-shade:—
content_old: 16 My face is reddened from weeping, And upon mine eyelashes is the death-shade:—

content: 17 Though no violence was in my hands, And my prayer was pure.
content_old: 17 Though no violence was in my hands, And my prayer was pure.

content: 18 O earth! do not cover my blood, And let there be no place for mine outcry.
content_old: 18 O earth! do not cover my blood, And let there be no place for mine outcry.

content: 19 Even now lo! in the heavens is my witness,
content_old: 19 Even now lo! in the heavens is my witness,

content: 20 And he that voucheth for me is on high. My friends are they who scorn me, Unto God hath mine eye shed tears:—
content_old: 20 And he that voucheth for me is on high. My friends are they who scorn me, Unto God hath mine eye shed tears:—

content: 21 That one might plead､ for a man､ with God,— Even a son of man, for his friend!
content_old: 21 That one might plead､ for a man､ with God,— Even a son of man, for his friend!

content: 1 My spirit is broken､ My days are extinguished, Graves are left me.
content_old: 1 My spirit is broken､ My days are extinguished, Graves are left me.

content: 2 Verily there are mockers､ with me! And on their insults mine eye doth rest.
content_old: 2 Verily there are mockers､ with me! And on their insults mine eye doth rest.

content: 3 Appoint it､ I pray thee､—be thou surety for me with thyself, Who is there that､ on my side､ can pledge himself?
content_old: 3 Appoint it､ I pray thee､—be thou surety for me with thyself, Who is there that､ on my side､ can pledge himself?

content: 4 For their heart hast thou kept back from understanding, On this account thou wilt not exalt them.
content_old: 4 For their heart hast thou kept back from understanding, On this account thou wilt not exalt them.

content: 5 He that for a share denounceth friends Even the eyes of his children shall be dim.
content_old: 5 He that for a share denounceth friends Even the eyes of his children shall be dim.

content: 6 But he hath set me､ as the byword of peoples, And one to be spit on in the face do I become.
content_old: 6 But he hath set me､ as the byword of peoples, And one to be spit on in the face do I become.

content: 7 Therefore hath mine eye become dim from vexation, And my members are like a shadow､ all of them.
content_old: 7 Therefore hath mine eye become dim from vexation, And my members are like a shadow､ all of them.

content: 8 Upright men shall be astounded over this, And the innocent against the impious shall rouse themselves.
content_old: 8 Upright men shall be astounded over this, And the innocent against the impious shall rouse themselves.

content: 9 That the righteous may hold on his way, And the clean of hands increase in strength.
content_old: 9 That the righteous may hold on his way, And the clean of hands increase in strength.

content: 10 But indeed､ as for them all will ye bethink yourselves and enter into it､ I pray you? Or shall I not find､ among you､ one who is wise?
content_old: 10 But indeed､ as for them all will ye bethink yourselves and enter into it､ I pray you? Or shall I not find､ among you､ one who is wise?

content: 11 My days are past､ my purposes are broken off, The possessions of my heart!
content_old: 11 My days are past､ my purposes are broken off, The possessions of my heart!

content: 12 Night for day they appoint, Light is near､ by reaspn of darkness!
content_old: 12 Night for day they appoint, Light is near､ by reaspn of darkness!

content: 13 If I wait for hades as my house, ln darkness have spread out my couch;
content_old: 13 If I wait for hades as my house, ln darkness have spread out my couch;

content: 14 To corruption have exclaimed､ My father thou! My mother! and My sister! to the worm
content_old: 14 To corruption have exclaimed､ My father thou! My mother! and My sister! to the worm

content: 15 Where then would be my hope? And as for my blessedness who should see it!
content_old: 15 Where then would be my hope? And as for my blessedness who should see it!

content: 1 Then responded Bildad the Shuhite､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Bildad the Shuhite､ and said:—

content: 2 How long will ye make a perversion of words? Ye should understand､ and afterwards we could speak.
content_old: 2 How long will ye make a perversion of words? Ye should understand､ and afterwards we could speak.

content: 3 Wherefore are we accounted like beasts? Or appear stupid､ in thine eyes?
content_old: 3 Wherefore are we accounted like beasts? Or appear stupid､ in thine eyes?

content: 4 One tearing in pieces his own soul in his anger— For thy sake shall the earth be forsaken? Or the rock be moved out of its place?
content_old: 4 One tearing in pieces his own soul in his anger— For thy sake shall the earth be forsaken? Or the rock be moved out of its place?

content: 5 Even the light of the lawless shall go out,— Neither shall shine the flame of his fire;
content_old: 5 Even the light of the lawless shall go out,— Neither shall shine the flame of his fire;

content: 6 The light hath darkened in his tent, Yea his lamp above him goeth out;
content_old: 6 The light hath darkened in his tent, Yea his lamp above him goeth out;

content: 7 The steppings of his strength are hemmed in, And his own counsel casteth him down;
content_old: 7 The steppings of his strength are hemmed in, And his own counsel casteth him down;

content: 8 For he is thrust into a net by his own feet, And upon a trap he marcheth;
content_old: 8 For he is thrust into a net by his own feet, And upon a trap he marcheth;

content: 9 There catcheth him—by the heel—a gin, There holdeth him fast—a noose:
content_old: 9 There catcheth him—by the heel—a gin, There holdeth him fast—a noose:

content: 10 Concealed in the ground is a cord for him,— And a snare for him､ on the path.
content_old: 10 Concealed in the ground is a cord for him,— And a snare for him､ on the path.

content: 11 Round about terrors have startled him, And have driven him to his feet.
content_old: 11 Round about terrors have startled him, And have driven him to his feet.

content: 12 Let his strength be famished, And calamity be ready at his side;
content_old: 12 Let his strength be famished, And calamity be ready at his side;

content: 13 Let it devour the members of his body, Let the firstborn of death devour his members;
content_old: 13 Let it devour the members of his body, Let the firstborn of death devour his members;

content: 14 Uprooted､ out of his tent､ be his confidence, And let it drive him down to the king of terrors;
content_old: 14 Uprooted､ out of his tent､ be his confidence, And let it drive him down to the king of terrors;

content: 15 There shall dwell in his tent､ what is naught-of-his, Let brimstone be strewed over his dwelling;
content_old: 15 There shall dwell in his tent､ what is naught-of-his, Let brimstone be strewed over his dwelling;

content: 16 Beneath let his roots be dried up, And above be cut off his branch;
content_old: 16 Beneath let his roots be dried up, And above be cut off his branch;

content: 17 His memorial have perished out of the land, And let him have no name over the face of the open field;
content_old: 17 His memorial have perished out of the land, And let him have no name over the face of the open field;

content: 18 Let them thrust him out of light into darkness, Yea out of the world let them chase him;
content_old: 18 Let them thrust him out of light into darkness, Yea out of the world let them chase him;

content: 19 Let him have neither scion nor seed among his people, Neither any survivor in his place of sojourn:
content_old: 19 Let him have neither scion nor seed among his people, Neither any survivor in his place of sojourn:

content: 20 Over his day have they been astounded who come behind, And them who are in advance a shudder hath seized.
content_old: 20 Over his day have they been astounded who come behind, And them who are in advance a shudder hath seized.

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 How long will ye grieve my soul? Or crush me with words?
content_old: 2 How long will ye grieve my soul? Or crush me with words?

content: 3 These ten times have ye reviled me, Shameless､ ye wrong me.
content_old: 3 These ten times have ye reviled me, Shameless､ ye wrong me.

content: 4 And even if indeed I have erred With myself lodgeth mine error.
content_old: 4 And even if indeed I have erred With myself lodgeth mine error.

content: 5 If indeed against me ye must needs magnify yourselves, And plead､ against me､ my reproach
content_old: 5 If indeed against me ye must needs magnify yourselves, And plead､ against me､ my reproach

content: 6 Know､ then､ that God hath overthrown me, And within his net enclosed me.
content_old: 6 Know､ then､ that God hath overthrown me, And within his net enclosed me.

content: 7 Lo! I cry—out Violence! but receive no answer, I cry aloud､ but there is no vindication;
content_old: 7 Lo! I cry—out Violence! but receive no answer, I cry aloud､ but there is no vindication;

content: 8 My way hath he walled up､ that I cannot pass, And upon my paths hath he made darkness rest;
content_old: 8 My way hath he walled up､ that I cannot pass, And upon my paths hath he made darkness rest;

content: 9 My glory—from off me hath he stripped, And hath removed the crown of my head;
content_old: 9 My glory—from off me hath he stripped, And hath removed the crown of my head;

content: 10 He hath ruined me on every side､ and I am gone, And he hath taken away—like a tree—my hope;
content_old: 10 He hath ruined me on every side､ and I am gone, And he hath taken away—like a tree—my hope;

content: 11 Yea he hath kindled against me his anger, And accounted me towards him like unto his adversaries;
content_old: 11 Yea he hath kindled against me his anger, And accounted me towards him like unto his adversaries;

content: 12 Together enter his troops. And have cast up､ against me､ their mound, And have encamped all around my tent;
content_old: 12 Together enter his troops. And have cast up､ against me､ their mound, And have encamped all around my tent;

content: 13 My brethren—from beside me hath he moved far away, And mine acquaintance are wholly estranged from me;
content_old: 13 My brethren—from beside me hath he moved far away, And mine acquaintance are wholly estranged from me;

content: 14 Failed me have my near of kin, And mine intimate acquaintances have forgotten me;
content_old: 14 Failed me have my near of kin, And mine intimate acquaintances have forgotten me;

content: 15 Ye guests of my house and my maidens A stranger have ye accounted me, An alien have I become in their eyes;
content_old: 15 Ye guests of my house and my maidens A stranger have ye accounted me, An alien have I become in their eyes;

content: 16 To mine own servant I called､ and he would not answer, With mine own mouth I kept entreating him;
content_old: 16 To mine own servant I called､ and he would not answer, With mine own mouth I kept entreating him;

content: 17 My breath is strange to my wife, And I am loathsome to the sons of my own mother;
content_old: 17 My breath is strange to my wife, And I am loathsome to the sons of my own mother;

content: 18 Even young children despise me, I rise up､ and they speak against me;
content_old: 18 Even young children despise me, I rise up､ and they speak against me;

content: 19 All the men of mine intimate circle abhor me, And these whom I loved have turned against me;
content_old: 19 All the men of mine intimate circle abhor me, And these whom I loved have turned against me;

content: 20 Unto my ski and unto my flesh have my bones cleaved, And I have escaped with the skin of my teeth.
content_old: 20 Unto my ski and unto my flesh have my bones cleaved, And I have escaped with the skin of my teeth.

content: 21 Pity me! pity me! ye､ my friends For the hand of God hath stricken me!
content_old: 21 Pity me! pity me! ye､ my friends For the hand of God hath stricken me!

content: 22 Wherefore should ye persecute me as GOD? And with my flesh should not be satisfied?
content_old: 22 Wherefore should ye persecute me as GOD? And with my flesh should not be satisfied?

content: 23 Oh､ then､ that my words could be written, Oh that in a record they could be inscribed:
content_old: 23 Oh､ then､ that my words could be written, Oh that in a record they could be inscribed:

content: 24 That with a stylus of iron and with lead For all time—in the rock they could be graven!
content_old: 24 That with a stylus of iron and with lead For all time—in the rock they could be graven!

content: 25 But I know that my redeemer liveth, And as the Last over my dust will he arise;
content_old: 25 But I know that my redeemer liveth, And as the Last over my dust will he arise;

content: 26 And though after my skin is struck off this followeth Yet apart from my flesh shall I see God:
content_old: 26 And though after my skin is struck off this followeth Yet apart from my flesh shall I see God:

content: 27 Whom I myself shall see､ on my side, And mine own eyes shall have looked upon､ and not those of a stranger. Exhausted are my deepest desires in my bosom!
content_old: 27 Whom I myself shall see､ on my side, And mine own eyes shall have looked upon､ and not those of a stranger. Exhausted are my deepest desires in my bosom!

content: 28 Surely ye should say— Why should we persecute him? Seeing the root of the matter is found in me.
content_old: 28 Surely ye should say— Why should we persecute him? Seeing the root of the matter is found in me.

content: 1 Then responded Zophar the Naamathite､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Zophar the Naamathite､ and said:—

content: 2 Not so do my thoughts answer me, And to this end, is my haste within me:
content_old: 2 Not so do my thoughts answer me, And to this end, is my haste within me:

content: 3 The correction meant to confound me I must hear, But the spirit—out of my understanding will give me a reply.
content_old: 3 The correction meant to confound me I must hear, But the spirit—out of my understanding will give me a reply.

content: 4 Knowest thou this—from antiquity, From the placing of man upon earth:—
content_old: 4 Knowest thou this—from antiquity, From the placing of man upon earth:—

content: 5 That the joy-shout of the lawless is short, And the rejoicing of the impious for a moment?
content_old: 5 That the joy-shout of the lawless is short, And the rejoicing of the impious for a moment?

content: 6 Though his elevation mount up to the heavens, And his head to the clouds doth reach
content_old: 6 Though his elevation mount up to the heavens, And his head to the clouds doth reach

content: 7 Like his own stubble shall he utterly perish, They who had seen him shall say､ Where is he?
content_old: 7 Like his own stubble shall he utterly perish, They who had seen him shall say､ Where is he?

content: 8 Like a dream shall he fly away､ and they shall not find him, Yea he shall be chased away､ as a vision of the night.
content_old: 8 Like a dream shall he fly away､ and they shall not find him, Yea he shall be chased away､ as a vision of the night.

content: 9 The eye that hath scanned him shall not do it again, Neither any more shall his place behold him:
content_old: 9 The eye that hath scanned him shall not do it again, Neither any more shall his place behold him:

content: 10 His children shall seek the favour of the poor, And his own hand shall give back his wealth.
content_old: 10 His children shall seek the favour of the poor, And his own hand shall give back his wealth.

content: 11 His bones are full of youthful vigour, Yet with him—in the dust shall it he down.
content_old: 11 His bones are full of youthful vigour, Yet with him—in the dust shall it he down.

content: 12 Though a sweet taste in his mouth be given by vice, Though he hide it under his tongue;
content_old: 12 Though a sweet taste in his mouth be given by vice, Though he hide it under his tongue;

content: 13 Though he spare it､ and will not let it go, But retain it in the midst of his mouth
content_old: 13 Though he spare it､ and will not let it go, But retain it in the midst of his mouth

content: 14 His food in his stomach is changed, The gall of adders､ within him!
content_old: 14 His food in his stomach is changed, The gall of adders､ within him!

content: 15 Wealth hath he swallowed､ and hath vomited the same, Out of his belly shall GOD drive it forth:
content_old: 15 Wealth hath he swallowed､ and hath vomited the same, Out of his belly shall GOD drive it forth:

content: 16 The poison of adders shall he suck, The tongue of the viper shall slay him;
content_old: 16 The poison of adders shall he suck, The tongue of the viper shall slay him;

content: 17 Let him not see in the channels The flowings of torrents of honey and milk.
content_old: 17 Let him not see in the channels The flowings of torrents of honey and milk.

content: 18 In vain he toiled､ he shall not swallow, Like wealth to be restored in which he cannot exult!
content_old: 18 In vain he toiled､ he shall not swallow, Like wealth to be restored in which he cannot exult!

content: 19 For he hath oppressed—hath forsaken the poor, A house hath he seized､ which he cannot rebuild.
content_old: 19 For he hath oppressed—hath forsaken the poor, A house hath he seized､ which he cannot rebuild.

content: 20 Surely he hath known no peace in his inmost mind,— With his dearest thing shall he not get away:
content_old: 20 Surely he hath known no peace in his inmost mind,— With his dearest thing shall he not get away:

content: 21 Nothing escaped his devouring greed,— For this cause shall his prosperity not continue:
content_old: 21 Nothing escaped his devouring greed,— For this cause shall his prosperity not continue:

content: 22 When his abundance is gone he shall be in straits, All the power of distress shall come upon him.
content_old: 22 When his abundance is gone he shall be in straits, All the power of distress shall come upon him.

content: 23 It shall be that to fill his belly he will thrust at him the glow of his anger, And rain it upon him for his punishment.
content_old: 23 It shall be that to fill his belly he will thrust at him the glow of his anger, And rain it upon him for his punishment.

content: 24 He shall flee from the armour of iron,— There shall pierce him､ a bow of bronze!
content_old: 24 He shall flee from the armour of iron,— There shall pierce him､ a bow of bronze!

content: 25 He hath drawn it out､ and it hath come forth out of his back,— Yea the flashing arrow-head､ out of his gall, There shall march on him—terrors:
content_old: 25 He hath drawn it out､ and it hath come forth out of his back,— Yea the flashing arrow-head､ out of his gall, There shall march on him—terrors:

content: 26 Every misfortune is laid up for his treasures,— There shall consume､ a fire not blown up,— It shall destroy what remaineth in his tent:
content_old: 26 Every misfortune is laid up for his treasures,— There shall consume､ a fire not blown up,— It shall destroy what remaineth in his tent:

content: 27 The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, And the earth be rising up against him:
content_old: 27 The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, And the earth be rising up against him:

content: 28 The increase of his house shall vanish, Melting away in the day of his anger.
content_old: 28 The increase of his house shall vanish, Melting away in the day of his anger.

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 Hear ye patiently my words, And let this be your consolation:
content_old: 2 Hear ye patiently my words, And let this be your consolation:

content: 3 Suffer me､ that I may speak, And after I have spoken thou canst mock!
content_old: 3 Suffer me､ that I may speak, And after I have spoken thou canst mock!

content: 4 Did I unto man make my complaint? Wherefore､ then､ should my spirit not be impatient?
content_old: 4 Did I unto man make my complaint? Wherefore､ then､ should my spirit not be impatient?

content: 5 Turn round to me､ and be astonished, And lay hand on mouth!
content_old: 5 Turn round to me､ and be astonished, And lay hand on mouth!

content: 6 When I call to mind then am I dismayed, And there seizeth my flesh a shuddering:—
content_old: 6 When I call to mind then am I dismayed, And there seizeth my flesh a shuddering:—

content: 7 Wherefore do lawless men live, Advance in years, even wax mighty in power?
content_old: 7 Wherefore do lawless men live, Advance in years, even wax mighty in power?

content: 8 Their seed is established in their sight along with them, Yea their offspring, before their eyes;
content_old: 8 Their seed is established in their sight along with them, Yea their offspring, before their eyes;

content: 9 Their houses are at peace､ without dread, Neither is the rod of God upon them;
content_old: 9 Their houses are at peace､ without dread, Neither is the rod of God upon them;

content: 10 His bull covereth､ and causeth not aversion, His cow safely calveth, and casteth not her young;
content_old: 10 His bull covereth､ and causeth not aversion, His cow safely calveth, and casteth not her young;

content: 11 They send forth—like a flock—their young ones, And their children skip about for joy;
content_old: 11 They send forth—like a flock—their young ones, And their children skip about for joy;

content: 12 They rejoice aloud as with timbrel and lyre, And make merry to the sound of the pipe;
content_old: 12 They rejoice aloud as with timbrel and lyre, And make merry to the sound of the pipe;

content: 13 They complete､ in prosperity､ their days, And in a moment to hades they sink down.
content_old: 13 They complete､ in prosperity､ their days, And in a moment to hades they sink down.

content: 14 Yet they said unto GOD､ Depart from us, and In the knowledge of thy ways find we no pleasure.
content_old: 14 Yet they said unto GOD､ Depart from us, and In the knowledge of thy ways find we no pleasure.

content: 15 What is the Almighty､ that we should serve him? Or what shall､ we profit, that we should urge him?
content_old: 15 What is the Almighty､ that we should serve him? Or what shall､ we profit, that we should urge him?

content: 16 Lo! not in their own hand is their welfare, The counsel of lawless men is far from me!
content_old: 16 Lo! not in their own hand is their welfare, The counsel of lawless men is far from me!

content: 17 How oft the lamp of the lawless goeth out､ And their calamity cometh upon them, Sorrows apportioneth he in his anger;
content_old: 17 How oft the lamp of the lawless goeth out､ And their calamity cometh upon them, Sorrows apportioneth he in his anger;

content: 18 They become as straw before the wind, And as chaff､ which the storm stealeth away.
content_old: 18 They become as straw before the wind, And as chaff､ which the storm stealeth away.

content: 19 Shall God reserve for his children his sorrow? Let him recompense him so that he may know it;
content_old: 19 Shall God reserve for his children his sorrow? Let him recompense him so that he may know it;

content: 20 His own eyes shall see his misfortune, And the wrath of the Almighty shall he drink.
content_old: 20 His own eyes shall see his misfortune, And the wrath of the Almighty shall he drink.

content: 21 For what shall be his pleasure in his house after him, When the number of his months is cut in twain?
content_old: 21 For what shall be his pleasure in his house after him, When the number of his months is cut in twain?

content: 22 Is it to GOD one can teach knowledge, Seeing that he shall judge them who are on high?
content_old: 22 Is it to GOD one can teach knowledge, Seeing that he shall judge them who are on high?

content: 23 This man dieth､ in the very perfection of his prosperity, Wholly tranquil and secure;
content_old: 23 This man dieth､ in the very perfection of his prosperity, Wholly tranquil and secure;

content: 24 His veins are filled with nourishment, And the marrow of his bones is fresh;
content_old: 24 His veins are filled with nourishment, And the marrow of his bones is fresh;

content: 25 Whereas this other man dieth､ in bitterness of soul, And hath never tasted good fortune:
content_old: 25 Whereas this other man dieth､ in bitterness of soul, And hath never tasted good fortune:

content: 26 Together in the dust they lie down, And the worm spreadeth a covering over them.
content_old: 26 Together in the dust they lie down, And the worm spreadeth a covering over them.

content: 27 Lo! I know your plans, And the devices､ wherewith ye would do me violence!
content_old: 27 Lo! I know your plans, And the devices､ wherewith ye would do me violence!

content: 28 For ye say､ Where is the house of the noble-minded? And where the dwelling-tent of the lawless?
content_old: 28 For ye say､ Where is the house of the noble-minded? And where the dwelling-tent of the lawless?

content: 29 Have ye not asked the passers-by in the way? And their signs can ye not recognise?
content_old: 29 Have ye not asked the passers-by in the way? And their signs can ye not recognise?

content: 30 That to the day of calamity is the wicked reserved, To the day of indignant visitation are they led.
content_old: 30 That to the day of calamity is the wicked reserved, To the day of indignant visitation are they led.

content: 31 Who can declare—to his face—his way? And what he hath done who shall recompense to him?
content_old: 31 Who can declare—to his face—his way? And what he hath done who shall recompense to him?

content: 32 Yet he to the graves is borne, And over the tomb one keepeth watch;
content_old: 32 Yet he to the graves is borne, And over the tomb one keepeth watch;

content: 33 Pleasant to him are the mounds of the torrent-bed,— And after him doth every man march, As before him there were､ without number.
content_old: 33 Pleasant to him are the mounds of the torrent-bed,— And after him doth every man march, As before him there were､ without number.

content: 1 Then responded Eliphaz the Temanite､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Eliphaz the Temanite､ and said:—

content: 2 Unto GOD can a man act as friend? Surely a discreet man befriendeth himself!
content_old: 2 Unto GOD can a man act as friend? Surely a discreet man befriendeth himself!

content: 3 Is it a pleasure to the Almighty､ that thou shouldst be righteous? Or any profit､ that thou shouldst be blameless in thy ways?
content_old: 3 Is it a pleasure to the Almighty､ that thou shouldst be righteous? Or any profit､ that thou shouldst be blameless in thy ways?

content: 4 Is it for thy reverence that he will accuse thee? will enter with thee into judgment?
content_old: 4 Is it for thy reverence that he will accuse thee? will enter with thee into judgment?

content: 5 Is not thy wickedness great? And without end are not thine iniquities?
content_old: 5 Is not thy wickedness great? And without end are not thine iniquities?

content: 6 Surely thou hast been wont to put thy brother in pledge for nothing, And the garments of the ill-clad hast thou stripped off:
content_old: 6 Surely thou hast been wont to put thy brother in pledge for nothing, And the garments of the ill-clad hast thou stripped off:

content: 7 No water—to the weary hast thou given to drink, And from the hungry thou hast withheld bread:
content_old: 7 No water—to the weary hast thou given to drink, And from the hungry thou hast withheld bread:

content: 8 A man of might to him pertaineth the land, And the favourite dwelleth therein:
content_old: 8 A man of might to him pertaineth the land, And the favourite dwelleth therein:

content: 9 Widows thou hast sent away empty, And the arms of the fatherless thou dost crush.
content_old: 9 Widows thou hast sent away empty, And the arms of the fatherless thou dost crush.

content: 10 For this cause round about thee are snares, And a dread startleth thee suddenly;
content_old: 10 For this cause round about thee are snares, And a dread startleth thee suddenly;

content: 11 Or darkness—thou canst not see, And a flood of waters covereth thee.
content_old: 11 Or darkness—thou canst not see, And a flood of waters covereth thee.

content: 12 Is not God in the height of the heavens? Behold､ then､ the head of the stars､ that they are high.
content_old: 12 Is not God in the height of the heavens? Behold､ then､ the head of the stars､ that they are high.

content: 13 Wilt thou say then､ What doth GOD know? Out through a thick cloud can he judge?
content_old: 13 Wilt thou say then､ What doth GOD know? Out through a thick cloud can he judge?

content: 14 Dark clouds are a veil to him､ and he cannot see, Or the vault of the heavens doth he walk?
content_old: 14 Dark clouds are a veil to him､ and he cannot see, Or the vault of the heavens doth he walk?

content: 15 The path of the ancient time wilt thou mark, Which the men of iniquity trod?
content_old: 15 The path of the ancient time wilt thou mark, Which the men of iniquity trod?

content: 16 Who were snatched away before the time, And a stream washed away their foundation?
content_old: 16 Who were snatched away before the time, And a stream washed away their foundation?

content: 17 Who had been saying unto GOD､ Depart from us! and— What can the Almighty do for himself?
content_old: 17 Who had been saying unto GOD､ Depart from us! and— What can the Almighty do for himself?

content: 18 Yet he had filled their houses with good! The counsel of the lawless then､ is far from me:
content_old: 18 Yet he had filled their houses with good! The counsel of the lawless then､ is far from me:

content: 19 The righteous shall see and rejoice, And the innocent shall laugh them to scorn:
content_old: 19 The righteous shall see and rejoice, And the innocent shall laugh them to scorn:

content: 20 If our assailants do not vanish Then their abundance a fire consumeth!
content_old: 20 If our assailants do not vanish Then their abundance a fire consumeth!

content: 21 Shew thyself to be one with him—I pray thee—and prosper, Thereby shall there come on thee blessing.
content_old: 21 Shew thyself to be one with him—I pray thee—and prosper, Thereby shall there come on thee blessing.

content: 22 Accept､ I beseech thee､ from his mouth—instruction,— And lay up his sayings in thy heart.
content_old: 22 Accept､ I beseech thee､ from his mouth—instruction,— And lay up his sayings in thy heart.

content: 23 If thou return unto the Almighty and submit thyself, If thou far remove perversity from thy tent
content_old: 23 If thou return unto the Almighty and submit thyself, If thou far remove perversity from thy tent

content: 24 Then lay up､ in the dust､ precious ore, And among the stones of the torrent-beds fine gold:
content_old: 24 Then lay up､ in the dust､ precious ore, And among the stones of the torrent-beds fine gold:

content: 25 So shall the Almighty become thy precious ores Yea glittering silver unto thee!
content_old: 25 So shall the Almighty become thy precious ores Yea glittering silver unto thee!

content: 26 For then in the Almighty shalt thou take exquisite delight, And shalt lift up—unto God—thy face;
content_old: 26 For then in the Almighty shalt thou take exquisite delight, And shalt lift up—unto God—thy face;

content: 27 Thou shalt make entreaty unto him､ and he will hear thee, And thy vows shalt thou pay;
content_old: 27 Thou shalt make entreaty unto him､ and he will hear thee, And thy vows shalt thou pay;

content: 28 And thou shalt decree a purpose､ and it shall be fulfilled unto thee, And upon thy ways shall have shone a light;
content_old: 28 And thou shalt decree a purpose､ and it shall be fulfilled unto thee, And upon thy ways shall have shone a light;

content: 29 When men cast themselves down then thou shalt say Up! And him that is of downcast eyes shall he save;
content_old: 29 When men cast themselves down then thou shalt say Up! And him that is of downcast eyes shall he save;

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 Even to-day is my complaint rebellion? His hand is heavier than my groaning.
content_old: 2 Even to-day is my complaint rebellion? His hand is heavier than my groaning.

content: 3 Oh that I knew where I might find him! I would come even unto his dwelling-place;
content_old: 3 Oh that I knew where I might find him! I would come even unto his dwelling-place;

content: 4 I would set out､ before him､ a plea, And my mouth would I fill with arguments;
content_old: 4 I would set out､ before him､ a plea, And my mouth would I fill with arguments;

content: 5 I would note the words wherewith he would respond to me, And would mark what he would say to me.
content_old: 5 I would note the words wherewith he would respond to me, And would mark what he would say to me.

content: 6 Would he with fulness of might contend with me? Nay､ surely he would give heed to me!
content_old: 6 Would he with fulness of might contend with me? Nay､ surely he would give heed to me!

content: 7 There an upright man might reason with him, So should I deliver myself completely from my judge.
content_old: 7 There an upright man might reason with him, So should I deliver myself completely from my judge.

content: 8 Behold! eastward I go､ but he is not there, And westward but I perceive him not;
content_old: 8 Behold! eastward I go､ but he is not there, And westward but I perceive him not;

content: 9 On the north､ where he worketh but I get no vision, He hideth himself on the south that I cannot see him.
content_old: 9 On the north､ where he worketh but I get no vision, He hideth himself on the south that I cannot see him.

content: 10 But he knoweth the way that I choose, Having tried me as gold I shall come forth.
content_old: 10 But he knoweth the way that I choose, Having tried me as gold I shall come forth.

content: 11 Of his steps my foot taketh hold, His way have I kept､ and not swerved;
content_old: 11 Of his steps my foot taketh hold, His way have I kept､ and not swerved;

content: 12 The command of his lips and would not go back, And in my bosom have I treasured the words of his lips.
content_old: 12 The command of his lips and would not go back, And in my bosom have I treasured the words of his lips.

content: 13 But he is one､ and who can turn him? What his soul desired he hath done.
content_old: 13 But he is one､ and who can turn him? What his soul desired he hath done.

content: 14 Surely he will accomplish what is decreed for me, And many such things hath he in store.
content_old: 14 Surely he will accomplish what is decreed for me, And many such things hath he in store.

content: 15 For this cause from his presence am I driven in fear, I diligently consider and am kept back from him in dread:
content_old: 15 For this cause from his presence am I driven in fear, I diligently consider and am kept back from him in dread:

content: 16 Yea GOD hath made timid my heart, And the Almighty hath put me in terror.
content_old: 16 Yea GOD hath made timid my heart, And the Almighty hath put me in terror.

content: 1 Wherefore since from the Almighty times are not hid Have his knowing ones no vision of his days?
content_old: 1 Wherefore since from the Almighty times are not hid Have his knowing ones no vision of his days?

content: 2 Boundaries men move back, Flocks they seize and consume;
content_old: 2 Boundaries men move back, Flocks they seize and consume;

content: 3 The ass of the fatherless they drive off, They take in pledge the ox of the widow;
content_old: 3 The ass of the fatherless they drive off, They take in pledge the ox of the widow;

content: 4 They turn aside the needy out of the way, At once are the humbled of the land made to hide themselves.
content_old: 4 They turn aside the needy out of the way, At once are the humbled of the land made to hide themselves.

content: 5 Lo! as wild asses in the wilderness they go forth with their work､ Eager seekers for prey, The waste plain yieldeth them food for their young;
content_old: 5 Lo! as wild asses in the wilderness they go forth with their work､ Eager seekers for prey, The waste plain yieldeth them food for their young;

content: 6 In the field—a man’s fodder they cut down, And the vineyard of the lawless they strip of its late berries;
content_old: 6 In the field—a man’s fodder they cut down, And the vineyard of the lawless they strip of its late berries;

content: 7 Ill-clad they are left to lodge without clothing, And have no covering in the cold;
content_old: 7 Ill-clad they are left to lodge without clothing, And have no covering in the cold;

content: 8 With the sweeping rain of the mountains are they wet, And through having no shelter they embrace a rock.
content_old: 8 With the sweeping rain of the mountains are they wet, And through having no shelter they embrace a rock.

content: 9 Men tear､ from the breast､ the fatherless, And over the poor they take a pledge;
content_old: 9 Men tear､ from the breast､ the fatherless, And over the poor they take a pledge;

content: 10 Naked they go about without clothing, And famished they carry the sheaves;
content_old: 10 Naked they go about without clothing, And famished they carry the sheaves;

content: 11 Between their walls are they exposed to the sun, Wine-presses they tread, and yet are thirsty;
content_old: 11 Between their walls are they exposed to the sun, Wine-presses they tread, and yet are thirsty;

content: 12 Out of the city—out of the houses they make outcry､ And the soul of the wounded calleth for help, And God doth not regard it as foolish.
content_old: 12 Out of the city—out of the houses they make outcry､ And the soul of the wounded calleth for help, And God doth not regard it as foolish.

content: 13 They have become rebels against the light,— They are not acquainted with the ways thereof, Neither abide they in the paths thereof.
content_old: 13 They have become rebels against the light,— They are not acquainted with the ways thereof, Neither abide they in the paths thereof.

content: 14 With the light riseth the murderer､ He slayeth the poor and needy, And in the night he becometh like a thief.
content_old: 14 With the light riseth the murderer､ He slayeth the poor and needy, And in the night he becometh like a thief.

content: 15 And the eye of the adulterer watcheth for the evening twilight､ Saying Not an eye will see me! A covering for the face he putteth on;
content_old: 15 And the eye of the adulterer watcheth for the evening twilight､ Saying Not an eye will see me! A covering for the face he putteth on;

content: 16 He breaketh､ in the dark､ into houses,— By day they lock themselves in, They know not the light;
content_old: 16 He breaketh､ in the dark､ into houses,— By day they lock themselves in, They know not the light;

content: 17 For in the case of all such morning to them is the death-shade, For to be recognised is a death-shade terror.
content_old: 17 For in the case of all such morning to them is the death-shade, For to be recognised is a death-shade terror.

content: 18 Swift is he on the face of the waters､ Speedily vanished their share in the land, He turneth not to the way of the vineyards.
content_old: 18 Swift is he on the face of the waters､ Speedily vanished their share in the land, He turneth not to the way of the vineyards.

content: 19 Drought and heat steal away snow water, Hades them who have sinned.
content_old: 19 Drought and heat steal away snow water, Hades them who have sinned.

content: 20 Maternal love shall forget him､ the worm shall find him sweet､ No more shall he be remembered, But perversity shall be shivered like a tree.
content_old: 20 Maternal love shall forget him､ the worm shall find him sweet､ No more shall he be remembered, But perversity shall be shivered like a tree.

content: 21 He oppresseth the barren who beareth not, And to the widow he doeth not good;
content_old: 21 He oppresseth the barren who beareth not, And to the widow he doeth not good;

content: 22 Yea he draggeth along the mighty by his strength, He riseth up, and none hath assurance of life;
content_old: 22 Yea he draggeth along the mighty by his strength, He riseth up, and none hath assurance of life;

content: 23 It is given him to be secure､ and confident, Yet his eyes are upon their ways.
content_old: 23 It is given him to be secure､ and confident, Yet his eyes are upon their ways.

content: 24 They are exalted a little､ and are not､ Yea having been laid low､ like all men are they gathered, Even as the top of an ear of corn do they hang down.
content_old: 24 They are exalted a little､ and are not､ Yea having been laid low､ like all men are they gathered, Even as the top of an ear of corn do they hang down.

content: 1 Then responded Bildad the Shuhite､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Bildad the Shuhite､ and said:—

content: 2 Dominion and dread are with him, Who causeth prosperity among his lofty ones;
content_old: 2 Dominion and dread are with him, Who causeth prosperity among his lofty ones;

content: 3 Is there any number to his troops? And upon whom ariseth not his light?
content_old: 3 Is there any number to his troops? And upon whom ariseth not his light?

content: 4 How then shall a mortal be just with GOD? Or how shall he be pure who is born of a woman?
content_old: 4 How then shall a mortal be just with GOD? Or how shall he be pure who is born of a woman?

content: 5 Look as far as the moon､ and it is not clear, And the stars are not bright in his eyes!
content_old: 5 Look as far as the moon､ and it is not clear, And the stars are not bright in his eyes!

content: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then responded Job､ and said:—

content: 2 How hast thou given help to one of no-strength? Given victory to an arm of no-power?
content_old: 2 How hast thou given help to one of no-strength? Given victory to an arm of no-power?

content: 3 How hast thou given counsel to one of no-wisdom? Or effective wisdom abundantly made known?
content_old: 3 How hast thou given counsel to one of no-wisdom? Or effective wisdom abundantly made known?

content: 4 Whom hast thou taught speech? Whose inspiration hath come from thee?
content_old: 4 Whom hast thou taught speech? Whose inspiration hath come from thee?

content: 5 The shades tremble, Beneath the waters and their inhabitants;
content_old: 5 The shades tremble, Beneath the waters and their inhabitants;

content: 6 Naked is hades before him, And there is no covering to destruction;
content_old: 6 Naked is hades before him, And there is no covering to destruction;

content: 7 Who stretcheth out the north over emptiness, Hangeth the earth upon nothingness;
content_old: 7 Who stretcheth out the north over emptiness, Hangeth the earth upon nothingness;

content: 8 Who bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds, And the cloud is not rent beneath them;
content_old: 8 Who bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds, And the cloud is not rent beneath them;

content: 9 Who shutteth-in the face of the throne, He spreadeth over it his cloud;
content_old: 9 Who shutteth-in the face of the throne, He spreadeth over it his cloud;

content: 10 A boundary hath he encircled on the face of the waters, As far as where light ends in darkness;
content_old: 10 A boundary hath he encircled on the face of the waters, As far as where light ends in darkness;

content: 11 The pillars of the heavens are shaken, And are terrified at his rebuke:
content_old: 11 The pillars of the heavens are shaken, And are terrified at his rebuke:

content: 12 By his strength hath he excited the sea, And by his skill hath he shattered the Crocodile:
content_old: 12 By his strength hath he excited the sea, And by his skill hath he shattered the Crocodile:

content: 13 By his spirit hath he arched the heavens, His hand hath pierced the fleeing serpent.
content_old: 13 By his spirit hath he arched the heavens, His hand hath pierced the fleeing serpent.

content: 1 And Job again took up his measure､ and said:—
content_old: 1 And Job again took up his measure､ and said:—

content: 2 As GOD liveth who hath taken away my right, Even the Almighty､ who hath embittered my soul;
content_old: 2 As GOD liveth who hath taken away my right, Even the Almighty､ who hath embittered my soul;

content: 3 All the while my inspiration is in me, And the spirit of God is in my nostrils
content_old: 3 All the while my inspiration is in me, And the spirit of God is in my nostrils

content: 4 Verily my lips shall not speak perversity, Nor shall my tongue utter deceit.
content_old: 4 Verily my lips shall not speak perversity, Nor shall my tongue utter deceit.

content: 5 Far be it from me! that I should justify you,— Even until I breathe my last will I not let go mine integrity from me:
content_old: 5 Far be it from me! that I should justify you,— Even until I breathe my last will I not let go mine integrity from me:

content: 6 On my righteousness have I taken fast hold､ and will not give it up, My heart shall not reproach any of my days.
content_old: 6 On my righteousness have I taken fast hold､ and will not give it up, My heart shall not reproach any of my days.

content: 7 Let mine enemy be a veritably lawless one! And he that lifteth himself up against me one veritably perverse!
content_old: 7 Let mine enemy be a veritably lawless one! And he that lifteth himself up against me one veritably perverse!

content: 8 For what shall be the hope of the impious､ though he graspeth with greed, When God shall draw forth his soul?
content_old: 8 For what shall be the hope of the impious､ though he graspeth with greed, When God shall draw forth his soul?

content: 9 His outcry will GOD hear, When there cometh upon him distress?
content_old: 9 His outcry will GOD hear, When there cometh upon him distress?

content: 10 Verily in the Almighty he will not find delight, Nor call on God continually!
content_old: 10 Verily in the Almighty he will not find delight, Nor call on God continually!

content: 11 I would teach you､ by the hand of GOD, That which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
content_old: 11 I would teach you､ by the hand of GOD, That which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

content: 12 Lo! ye have all of you seen, Wherefore､ then､ is it that ye are utterly without purpose?
content_old: 12 Lo! ye have all of you seen, Wherefore､ then､ is it that ye are utterly without purpose?

content: 13 This is the portion of a lawless man with GOD, That the heritage of tyrants—from the Almighty he shall receive.
content_old: 13 This is the portion of a lawless man with GOD, That the heritage of tyrants—from the Almighty he shall receive.

content: 14 lf his children be multiplied for them there is the sword, And his offspring shall not be filled with bread;
content_old: 14 lf his children be multiplied for them there is the sword, And his offspring shall not be filled with bread;

content: 15 His survivors by pestilence shall come to the grave, And his widows shall not weep;
content_old: 15 His survivors by pestilence shall come to the grave, And his widows shall not weep;

content: 16 Though he heap up silver like dust, And like a pile he prepare clothing
content_old: 16 Though he heap up silver like dust, And like a pile he prepare clothing

content: 17 He may prepare､ but the righteous shall put on, And the silver shall the innocent apportion.
content_old: 17 He may prepare､ but the righteous shall put on, And the silver shall the innocent apportion.

content: 18 He hath built､ like a moth､ his house,— Like a hut, which a watcher hath made.
content_old: 18 He hath built､ like a moth､ his house,— Like a hut, which a watcher hath made.

content: 19 The rich man shall lie down､ and not do it again, His eyes hath he opened､ and then is not.
content_old: 19 The rich man shall lie down､ and not do it again, His eyes hath he opened､ and then is not.

content: 20 There shall reach him—like waters—terrors, By night a storm-wind hath stolen him away;
content_old: 20 There shall reach him—like waters—terrors, By night a storm-wind hath stolen him away;

content: 21 An east wind shall lift him up､ and he shall depart, And it shall sweep him away out of his place;
content_old: 21 An east wind shall lift him up､ and he shall depart, And it shall sweep him away out of his place;

content: 22 And He will cast upon him and not spare, Out of his hand shall he swiftly flee;
content_old: 22 And He will cast upon him and not spare, Out of his hand shall he swiftly flee;

content: 1 Though there is for silver a vein, And a place for the gold they refine;
content_old: 1 Though there is for silver a vein, And a place for the gold they refine;

content: 2 Iron out of the ore is taken, And stone poureth out copper;
content_old: 2 Iron out of the ore is taken, And stone poureth out copper;

content: 3 An end hath one set to the darkness､ And into every extremity is he making search, For the stone of darkness and death-shade;
content_old: 3 An end hath one set to the darkness､ And into every extremity is he making search, For the stone of darkness and death-shade;

content: 4 He hath sunken a shaft､ away from the inhabitants Places forsaken by the foot, They hang down､ away from men sway to and fro;
content_old: 4 He hath sunken a shaft､ away from the inhabitants Places forsaken by the foot, They hang down､ away from men sway to and fro;

content: 5 As for the earth out of it cometh forth bread, And under it is upturned､ as it were fire;
content_old: 5 As for the earth out of it cometh forth bread, And under it is upturned､ as it were fire;

content: 6 The place of sapphires are the stones thereof, And it hath nuggets of gold:—
content_old: 6 The place of sapphires are the stones thereof, And it hath nuggets of gold:—

content: 7 A path､ the vulture hath not discerned, Nor hath the eye of the hawk scanned it;
content_old: 7 A path､ the vulture hath not discerned, Nor hath the eye of the hawk scanned it;

content: 8 Ravenous beasts have not made a track thereof, Neither hath the lion marched thereon:
content_old: 8 Ravenous beasts have not made a track thereof, Neither hath the lion marched thereon:

content: 9 Upon the flint hath he thrust forth his hand, He hath turned up mountains by the roots;
content_old: 9 Upon the flint hath he thrust forth his hand, He hath turned up mountains by the roots;

content: 10 Among the rocks hath he cut open streams, And every precious thing hath his eye seen:
content_old: 10 Among the rocks hath he cut open streams, And every precious thing hath his eye seen:

content: 11 From trickling he restraineth rivers, And some hidden thing is he bringing out to light
content_old: 11 From trickling he restraineth rivers, And some hidden thing is he bringing out to light

content: 12 Yet where can Wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
content_old: 12 Yet where can Wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?

content: 13 Mortal knoweth not the way thereof, Neither can it be found in the land of the living;
content_old: 13 Mortal knoweth not the way thereof, Neither can it be found in the land of the living;

content: 14 The resounding deep hath said､ It is not in me! And the sea hathsaid, It is not with me!
content_old: 14 The resounding deep hath said､ It is not in me! And the sea hathsaid, It is not with me!

content: 15 Pure gold cannot be given in its stead, Neither can silver be weighed as the value thereof;
content_old: 15 Pure gold cannot be given in its stead, Neither can silver be weighed as the value thereof;

content: 16 It cannot be put into the scales against the gold of Ophir, With costly onyx､ or sapphire;
content_old: 16 It cannot be put into the scales against the gold of Ophir, With costly onyx､ or sapphire;

content: 17 Neither gold nor crystal can compare with it, Nor can the exchange thereof be a vessel of pure gold､
content_old: 17 Neither gold nor crystal can compare with it, Nor can the exchange thereof be a vessel of pure gold､

content: 18 Coral or crystal cannot be mentioned, Yea a possession is wisdom､ above red coral;
content_old: 18 Coral or crystal cannot be mentioned, Yea a possession is wisdom､ above red coral;

content: 19 The topaz of Ethiopia cannot compare with it, Against purest gold can it not be weighed.
content_old: 19 The topaz of Ethiopia cannot compare with it, Against purest gold can it not be weighed.

content: 20 Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding?
content_old: 20 Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding?

content: 21 Seeing it hath been hid from the eyes of every living thing, And from the bird of the heavens hath it been concealed?
content_old: 21 Seeing it hath been hid from the eyes of every living thing, And from the bird of the heavens hath it been concealed?

content: 22 Destruction and death have said, With our ears have we heard the report thereof!
content_old: 22 Destruction and death have said, With our ears have we heard the report thereof!

content: 23 God understandeth the way thereof, And he diacerneth the place thereof;
content_old: 23 God understandeth the way thereof, And he diacerneth the place thereof;

content: 24 For he unto the ends of the earth directeth his look, Under all the heavens he seeth;
content_old: 24 For he unto the ends of the earth directeth his look, Under all the heavens he seeth;

content: 25 Making for the wind a weight, And the waters he proved by measure,
content_old: 25 Making for the wind a weight, And the waters he proved by measure,

content: 26 When he made for the rain a decree, And a way for the lightning of thunders
content_old: 26 When he made for the rain a decree, And a way for the lightning of thunders

content: 27 Then saw he it､ and declared it, He settled it､ yea also he searched it out;
content_old: 27 Then saw he it､ and declared it, He settled it､ yea also he searched it out;

content: 1 And Job again took up his measure､ and said:—
content_old: 1 And Job again took up his measure､ and said:—

content: 2 Oh that it were with me as in the months of old, As in the days when God used to watch over me;
content_old: 2 Oh that it were with me as in the months of old, As in the days when God used to watch over me;

content: 3 When his lamp shone over my head, By whose light I could go through darkness;
content_old: 3 When his lamp shone over my head, By whose light I could go through darkness;

content: 4 As I was､ in the days of my prime, When the intimacy of God was over my tent;
content_old: 4 As I was､ in the days of my prime, When the intimacy of God was over my tent;

content: 5 While yet the Almighty was with me, Round about me were my young men;
content_old: 5 While yet the Almighty was with me, Round about me were my young men;

content: 6 When my steps were bathed in milk, And the rock poured out beside me､ rivulets of oil:
content_old: 6 When my steps were bathed in milk, And the rock poured out beside me､ rivulets of oil:

content: 7 When I went out to the gate unto the city, In the open place made ready my seat
content_old: 7 When I went out to the gate unto the city, In the open place made ready my seat

content: 8 Young men saw me､ and hid themselves, And the aged arose—they stood;
content_old: 8 Young men saw me､ and hid themselves, And the aged arose—they stood;

content: 9 Rulers restrained speech, And a hand laid they on their mouth;
content_old: 9 Rulers restrained speech, And a hand laid they on their mouth;

content: 10 The voice of nobles was hushed, And their tongue to their palate did cleave;
content_old: 10 The voice of nobles was hushed, And their tongue to their palate did cleave;

content: 11 When the ear heard､ then it pronounced me happy, When the eye saw then it bare me witness;
content_old: 11 When the ear heard､ then it pronounced me happy, When the eye saw then it bare me witness;

content: 12 Because I used to deliver the oppressed who was crying out for aid, The fatherless also､ and him that had no helper;
content_old: 12 Because I used to deliver the oppressed who was crying out for aid, The fatherless also､ and him that had no helper;

content: 13 The blessing of him that was ready to perish upon me was wont to descend, And the heart of the widow caused I to sing for joy;
content_old: 13 The blessing of him that was ready to perish upon me was wont to descend, And the heart of the widow caused I to sing for joy;

content: 14 Righteousness I put on､ and it clothed me, Like a robe and turban was my justice;
content_old: 14 Righteousness I put on､ and it clothed me, Like a robe and turban was my justice;

content: 15 Eyes became I to the blind , And feet to the lame was I!
content_old: 15 Eyes became I to the blind , And feet to the lame was I!

content: 16 A father was I to the needy, And as for the cause which I knew not I used to search it out;
content_old: 16 A father was I to the needy, And as for the cause which I knew not I used to search it out;

content: 17 And I shivered the fangs of the perverse,— And out of his teeth I tare the prey.
content_old: 17 And I shivered the fangs of the perverse,— And out of his teeth I tare the prey.

content: 18 Then said I､ Like a stem shall I grow old, Yea as the sand shall I multiply days;
content_old: 18 Then said I､ Like a stem shall I grow old, Yea as the sand shall I multiply days;

content: 19 My root is laid open to the waters, And the dew shall lodge for the night in my boughs;
content_old: 19 My root is laid open to the waters, And the dew shall lodge for the night in my boughs;

content: 20 Mine honour shall be young again with me, And my bow in my hand be renewed.
content_old: 20 Mine honour shall be young again with me, And my bow in my hand be renewed.

content: 21 To me men hearkened､ and waited, And kept silence for my counsel;
content_old: 21 To me men hearkened､ and waited, And kept silence for my counsel;

content: 22 After I had spoken they spake not again, And upon them used my speech to drop;
content_old: 22 After I had spoken they spake not again, And upon them used my speech to drop;

content: 23 And they waited as for rain for me, And their mouths they opened wide for the spring-rain;
content_old: 23 And they waited as for rain for me, And their mouths they opened wide for the spring-rain;

content: 24 I laughed at them—they lost confidence, And the light of my countenance they suffered not to fail;
content_old: 24 I laughed at them—they lost confidence, And the light of my countenance they suffered not to fail;

content: 1 But now they who are of fewer days than I､ have poured derision upon me; Whose fathers I refused— To set with the dogs of my flock.
content_old: 1 But now they who are of fewer days than I､ have poured derision upon me; Whose fathers I refused— To set with the dogs of my flock.

content: 2 Even the strength of their hands wherefore was it mine? Upon them vigour was lost;
content_old: 2 Even the strength of their hands wherefore was it mine? Upon them vigour was lost;

content: 3 ln want and hunger they were lean,— Who used to gnaw the dry ground, A dark night of desolation!
content_old: 3 ln want and hunger they were lean,— Who used to gnaw the dry ground, A dark night of desolation!

content: 4 Who used to pluck off the mallow by the bushes, With the root of the broom for their food;
content_old: 4 Who used to pluck off the mallow by the bushes, With the root of the broom for their food;

content: 5 Out of the midst were they driven, Men shouted after them､ as after a thief;
content_old: 5 Out of the midst were they driven, Men shouted after them､ as after a thief;

content: 6 ln the fissures of the ravines had they to dwell, In holes of dust and crags;
content_old: 6 ln the fissures of the ravines had they to dwell, In holes of dust and crags;

content: 7 Among the bushes used they to shriek, Under the bramble were they huddled together:
content_old: 7 Among the bushes used they to shriek, Under the bramble were they huddled together:

content: 8 Sons of the base､ yea sons of the nameless They were scourged out of the land.
content_old: 8 Sons of the base､ yea sons of the nameless They were scourged out of the land.

content: 9 But now their song have I become, Yea I serve them for a byword;
content_old: 9 But now their song have I become, Yea I serve them for a byword;

content: 10 They abhor me—have put themselves far from me, And from my face have not withheld—spittle!
content_old: 10 They abhor me—have put themselves far from me, And from my face have not withheld—spittle!

content: 11 Because my girdle he had loosened and had humbled me Therefore the bridle—in my presence cast they off;
content_old: 11 Because my girdle he had loosened and had humbled me Therefore the bridle—in my presence cast they off;

content: 12 On my right hand the young brood rose up,— My feet they thrust aside, And cast up against me their earthworks of destruction;
content_old: 12 On my right hand the young brood rose up,— My feet they thrust aside, And cast up against me their earthworks of destruction;

content: 13 They brake up my path,— My engulphing ruin they helped forward unaided;
content_old: 13 They brake up my path,— My engulphing ruin they helped forward unaided;

content: 14 As through a wide breach came they on, With a crashing noise they rolled themselves along.
content_old: 14 As through a wide breach came they on, With a crashing noise they rolled themselves along.

content: 15 There are turned upon me terrors,— Chased away as with a wind is mine abundance, And as a cloud hath passed away my prosperity.
content_old: 15 There are turned upon me terrors,— Chased away as with a wind is mine abundance, And as a cloud hath passed away my prosperity.

content: 16 Now therefore over myself my soul poureth itself out, There seize me days of affliction:
content_old: 16 Now therefore over myself my soul poureth itself out, There seize me days of affliction:

content: 17 Night boreth my bones all over me,— And my sinews find no rest;
content_old: 17 Night boreth my bones all over me,— And my sinews find no rest;

content: 18 Most effectually is my skin disfigured,— Like the collar of my tunic it girdeth me about:
content_old: 18 Most effectually is my skin disfigured,— Like the collar of my tunic it girdeth me about:

content: 19 He hath cast me into the mire, And I have become like dust and ashes.
content_old: 19 He hath cast me into the mire, And I have become like dust and ashes.

content: 20 I cry out for help unto thee､ and thou dost not answer, I stand still､ and thou dost gaze at me;
content_old: 20 I cry out for help unto thee､ and thou dost not answer, I stand still､ and thou dost gaze at me;

content: 21 Thou art turned to become a cruel one unto me, With the might of thy hand thou assailest me;
content_old: 21 Thou art turned to become a cruel one unto me, With the might of thy hand thou assailest me;

content: 22 Thou liftest up me to the wind､ thou carriest me away, And the storm maketh me faint;
content_old: 22 Thou liftest up me to the wind､ thou carriest me away, And the storm maketh me faint;

content: 23 For I know that unto death thou wilt bring me back, Even unto the house of meeting for every one living.
content_old: 23 For I know that unto death thou wilt bring me back, Even unto the house of meeting for every one living.

content: 24 Only against a heap of ruins will one not thrust a hand! Surely when one is in calamity—for that very reason is there an outcry for help.
content_old: 24 Only against a heap of ruins will one not thrust a hand! Surely when one is in calamity—for that very reason is there an outcry for help.

content: 25 Verily I wept､ for him whose lot was hard, Grieved was my soul､ for the needy.
content_old: 25 Verily I wept､ for him whose lot was hard, Grieved was my soul､ for the needy.

content: 26 Surely for good I looked､ but there came in evil, And I waited for light､ but there came in darkness;
content_old: 26 Surely for good I looked､ but there came in evil, And I waited for light､ but there came in darkness;

content: 27 I boiled within me､ and rested not, There confronted me—days of affliction;
content_old: 27 I boiled within me､ and rested not, There confronted me—days of affliction;

content: 28 ln gloom I walked along､ without sun, I arose—in the convocation I cried out for help;
content_old: 28 ln gloom I walked along､ without sun, I arose—in the convocation I cried out for help;

content: 29 A brother became I to the brutes that howl, And a companion to the birds that screech:
content_old: 29 A brother became I to the brutes that howl, And a companion to the birds that screech:

content: 30 My skin turned black､ and peeled off me, And my bones burned with heat:
content_old: 30 My skin turned black､ and peeled off me, And my bones burned with heat:

content: 1 A covenant I solemnised for mine eyes,—How then could I gaze upon a virgin?
content_old: 1 A covenant I solemnised for mine eyes,—How then could I gaze upon a virgin?

content: 2 Or what would have been my portion of God from above? Or what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
content_old: 2 Or what would have been my portion of God from above? Or what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

content: 3 Is there not calamity､ for the perverse? And misfortune､ for the workers of iniquity?
content_old: 3 Is there not calamity､ for the perverse? And misfortune､ for the workers of iniquity?

content: 4 Would he not see my ways? And of all my steps take account?
content_old: 4 Would he not see my ways? And of all my steps take account?

content: 5 Verily I walked not in falsity, Nor did my foot haste unto deceit:—
content_old: 5 Verily I walked not in falsity, Nor did my foot haste unto deceit:—

content: 6 Let him weigh me in balances of righteousness,— And let God take note of mine integrity!
content_old: 6 Let him weigh me in balances of righteousness,— And let God take note of mine integrity!

content: 7 If my goings have swerved from the way,— And after mine eyes hath gone my heart, And to my hands hath adhered any stain
content_old: 7 If my goings have swerved from the way,— And after mine eyes hath gone my heart, And to my hands hath adhered any stain

content: 8 Let me sow but another eat. And let what I have springing up be uprooted!
content_old: 8 Let me sow but another eat. And let what I have springing up be uprooted!

content: 9 If my heart hath been enticed unto a woman, Or by the door of my neighbour I have lien in wait
content_old: 9 If my heart hath been enticed unto a woman, Or by the door of my neighbour I have lien in wait

content: 10 Let my wife grind to another, And over her let others bend!
content_old: 10 Let my wife grind to another, And over her let others bend!

content: 11 Surely that had been a shameful thing! And that an iniquity for the judges!
content_old: 11 Surely that had been a shameful thing! And that an iniquity for the judges!

content: 12 Surely a fire had that been､ which unto destruction would have consumed, And of all mine increase had it torn up the root.
content_old: 12 Surely a fire had that been､ which unto destruction would have consumed, And of all mine increase had it torn up the root.

content: 13 If I refused the right of my servant､ or my handmaid, When they contended with me
content_old: 13 If I refused the right of my servant､ or my handmaid, When they contended with me

content: 14 What then could I have done when GOD rose up? And when he visited what could I have answered him?
content_old: 14 What then could I have done when GOD rose up? And when he visited what could I have answered him?

content: 15 Did not he who､ in the womb､ made me make him? And is not he who formed us in the body one?
content_old: 15 Did not he who､ in the womb､ made me make him? And is not he who formed us in the body one?

content: 16 If I withheld—from pleasure—the poor, Or the eyes of the widow I dimmed;
content_old: 16 If I withheld—from pleasure—the poor, Or the eyes of the widow I dimmed;

content: 17 Or used to eat my morsel alone, so that the fatherless did not eat thereof;
content_old: 17 Or used to eat my morsel alone, so that the fatherless did not eat thereof;

content: 18 Surely from my youth he grew up to me､ as to a father, And from my birth I acted as guide to her:
content_old: 18 Surely from my youth he grew up to me､ as to a father, And from my birth I acted as guide to her:

content: 19 If I saw one perishing for lack of clothing, Or that the needy had no covering;
content_old: 19 If I saw one perishing for lack of clothing, Or that the needy had no covering;

content: 20 If his loins did not bless me, Or if with the fleece of my lambs he did not warm himself;
content_old: 20 If his loins did not bless me, Or if with the fleece of my lambs he did not warm himself;

content: 21 If I shook—against the fatherless—my hand, When I saw､ in the gate､ his need of my help
content_old: 21 If I shook—against the fatherless—my hand, When I saw､ in the gate､ his need of my help

content: 22 Let my shoulder from the shoulder-blade fall, And my arm from the upper bone be broken;
content_old: 22 Let my shoulder from the shoulder-blade fall, And my arm from the upper bone be broken;

content: 23 For a dread unto me was calamity from GOD, And from his majesty I could not escape.
content_old: 23 For a dread unto me was calamity from GOD, And from his majesty I could not escape.

content: 24 If I made gold my stay, And to precious metal said､ My confidence!
content_old: 24 If I made gold my stay, And to precious metal said､ My confidence!

content: 25 If I rejoiced because great was my substance, And an abundance my hand had discovered;
content_old: 25 If I rejoiced because great was my substance, And an abundance my hand had discovered;

content: 26 If I looked at the sun､ when it flashed forth light, Or at the moon､ majestically marching along;
content_old: 26 If I looked at the sun､ when it flashed forth light, Or at the moon､ majestically marching along;

content: 27 And befooled secretly was my heart, So that my hand kissed my mouth
content_old: 27 And befooled secretly was my heart, So that my hand kissed my mouth

content: 28 That too had been a judicial iniquity, For I should have been false to GOD above.
content_old: 28 That too had been a judicial iniquity, For I should have been false to GOD above.

content: 29 If I rejoiced in the misfortune of him that hated me, Or exulted when calamity found him;—
content_old: 29 If I rejoiced in the misfortune of him that hated me, Or exulted when calamity found him;—

content: 30 Neither did I suffer my palate to sin, By asking､ with a curse､ for his life:
content_old: 30 Neither did I suffer my palate to sin, By asking､ with a curse､ for his life:

content: 31 If the men of my household have not said, Oh for some of his flesh—we cannot get filled,
content_old: 31 If the men of my household have not said, Oh for some of his flesh—we cannot get filled,

content: 32 Outside the sojourner lodged not for the night, My doors—to the wayfarer I threw open.
content_old: 32 Outside the sojourner lodged not for the night, My doors—to the wayfarer I threw open.

content: 33 If I covered､ like Adam､ my transgressions, By hiding in my bosom mine iniquity
content_old: 33 If I covered､ like Adam､ my transgressions, By hiding in my bosom mine iniquity

content: 34 Then let me be made to tremble at a great throng､ Yea let the contempt of families terrify me, So that､ keeping silence､ I shall not go out of the door!
content_old: 34 Then let me be made to tremble at a great throng､ Yea let the contempt of families terrify me, So that､ keeping silence､ I shall not go out of the door!

content: 35 Oh that I had one to hear me､ Lo! my crossmark､ May the Almighty answer me! And would that a book mine opponent had written!
content_old: 35 Oh that I had one to hear me､ Lo! my crossmark､ May the Almighty answer me! And would that a book mine opponent had written!

content: 36 Oh! would I not upon my shoulder lift it, Or bind it as a crown upon me;
content_old: 36 Oh! would I not upon my shoulder lift it, Or bind it as a crown upon me;

content: 37 The number of my footsteps I would declare to him, Like a noble would I draw near to him.
content_old: 37 The number of my footsteps I would declare to him, Like a noble would I draw near to him.

content: 38 If against me my ground used to cry out, And together my ridges did weep;
content_old: 38 If against me my ground used to cry out, And together my ridges did weep;

content: 39 If the strength thereof I used to eat､ without payment, And the soul of the holders thereof I made groan
content_old: 39 If the strength thereof I used to eat､ without payment, And the soul of the holders thereof I made groan

content: 1 So these three men ceased to respond to Job, because he was righteous in their eyes.
content_old: 1 So these three men ceased to respond to Job, because he was righteous in their eyes.

content: 2 Then was kindled the anger of Elihu､ son of Barachel the Buzite of the family of Ram,—against Job was kindled his anger, because he justified his own soul rather than God;
content_old: 2 Then was kindled the anger of Elihu､ son of Barachel the Buzite of the family of Ram,—against Job was kindled his anger, because he justified his own soul rather than God;

content: 3 and against his three friends was kindled his anger,—because that they found not a response, and condemned God.
content_old: 3 and against his three friends was kindled his anger,—because that they found not a response, and condemned God.

content: 4 But Elihu had waited for Job with words, because the others were older than he.
content_old: 4 But Elihu had waited for Job with words, because the others were older than he.

content: 5 Howbeit when Elihu saw that there was no response in the mouth of the three men then was kindled his anger.
content_old: 5 Howbeit when Elihu saw that there was no response in the mouth of the three men then was kindled his anger.

content: 6 So then Elihu､ son of Barachel､ the Buzite､ responded and said:— Young am I､ whereas ye are aged, For this cause I faltered､ and feared— To shew my knowledge unto you:
content_old: 6 So then Elihu､ son of Barachel､ the Buzite､ responded and said:— Young am I､ whereas ye are aged, For this cause I faltered､ and feared— To shew my knowledge unto you:

content: 7 I said､ Days should speak,— And the multitude of years should make known wisdom.
content_old: 7 I said､ Days should speak,— And the multitude of years should make known wisdom.

content: 8 Yet surely there is a spirit in men, And the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding;
content_old: 8 Yet surely there is a spirit in men, And the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding;

content: 9 Great men may not be wise, Nor elders understand justice.
content_old: 9 Great men may not be wise, Nor elders understand justice.

content: 10 Therefore I said､ Hearken unto me, I will shew my knowledge—even I.
content_old: 10 Therefore I said､ Hearken unto me, I will shew my knowledge—even I.

content: 11 Lo! I waited for your words､ I kept giving ear for your reasons, Until ye should search out what to say;
content_old: 11 Lo! I waited for your words､ I kept giving ear for your reasons, Until ye should search out what to say;

content: 12 Yea unto you gave I diligent heed,— But lo! there was､ for Job､ nothing to convince, Nor could one of you answer his speeches.
content_old: 12 Yea unto you gave I diligent heed,— But lo! there was､ for Job､ nothing to convince, Nor could one of you answer his speeches.

content: 13 Lest ye should say､ We have found out wisdom. GOD must put him to flight､ not man.
content_old: 13 Lest ye should say､ We have found out wisdom. GOD must put him to flight､ not man.

content: 14 Since he directed not to me discourse Therefore with your speeches will I not reply to him.
content_old: 14 Since he directed not to me discourse Therefore with your speeches will I not reply to him.

content: 15 They were dismayed､ they responded no more, They suffered speech to forsake them;
content_old: 15 They were dismayed､ they responded no more, They suffered speech to forsake them;

content: 16 Though I waited yet could they not speak, Surely they came to a stand､ they responded no more.
content_old: 16 Though I waited yet could they not speak, Surely they came to a stand､ they responded no more.

content: 17 I will respond even I—on my part, I will shew my knowledge､ even I!
content_old: 17 I will respond even I—on my part, I will shew my knowledge､ even I!

content: 18 For I am full of discourse, The spirit in my bosom presseth me on.
content_old: 18 For I am full of discourse, The spirit in my bosom presseth me on.

content: 19 Lo! my bosom is like wine not opened, Like new wine-skins it will burst.
content_old: 19 Lo! my bosom is like wine not opened, Like new wine-skins it will burst.

content: 20 I will speak､ that I may freely breathe, I will open my lips and respond.
content_old: 20 I will speak､ that I may freely breathe, I will open my lips and respond.

content: 21 Let me be partial to no man, And unto no son of earth give flattering titles,
content_old: 21 Let me be partial to no man, And unto no son of earth give flattering titles,

content: 1 But in very deed hear､ I pray thee､ Job､ my discourse, And to all my words give thou ear.
content_old: 1 But in very deed hear､ I pray thee､ Job､ my discourse, And to all my words give thou ear.

content: 2 Lo! I pray thee､ I have opened my mouth､ My tongue､ with my palate､ hath spoken､
content_old: 2 Lo! I pray thee､ I have opened my mouth､ My tongue､ with my palate､ hath spoken､

content: 3 Mine utterances come straight from mine own heart, And what I know my lips have truly spoken;
content_old: 3 Mine utterances come straight from mine own heart, And what I know my lips have truly spoken;

content: 4 The spirit of GOD hath made me, And the inspiration of the Almighty giveth me life.
content_old: 4 The spirit of GOD hath made me, And the inspiration of the Almighty giveth me life.
