content: 5 If thou art able to answer me Set in order before me—take thy stand!
content_old: 5 If thou art able to answer me Set in order before me—take thy stand!

content: 6 Lo! I am like thyself toward GOD, From clay have I been nipped off even I!
content_old: 6 Lo! I am like thyself toward GOD, From clay have I been nipped off even I!

content: 7 Lo! my terror will not startle thee, Nor my hand upon thee be heavy.
content_old: 7 Lo! my terror will not startle thee, Nor my hand upon thee be heavy.

content: 8 But thou hast spoken in mine ears, And the sound of words I heard:—
content_old: 8 But thou hast spoken in mine ears, And the sound of words I heard:—

content: 9 Pure am I､ without transgression,— Clean am I, and have no iniquity;
content_old: 9 Pure am I､ without transgression,— Clean am I, and have no iniquity;

content: 10 Lo! occasions of hostility would he find against me, He counteth me an enemy to him;
content_old: 10 Lo! occasions of hostility would he find against me, He counteth me an enemy to him;

content: 11 He putteth—in the stocks—my feet, He watcheth all my paths.
content_old: 11 He putteth—in the stocks—my feet, He watcheth all my paths.

content: 12 Lo! in this thou hast not been right—let me answer thee, For God is greater than man.
content_old: 12 Lo! in this thou hast not been right—let me answer thee, For God is greater than man.

content: 13 Wherefore against him hast thou contended? For with none of his reasons will he respond.
content_old: 13 Wherefore against him hast thou contended? For with none of his reasons will he respond.

content: 14 For in one way GOD may speak,— And in a second way one may not heed it:—
content_old: 14 For in one way GOD may speak,— And in a second way one may not heed it:—

content: 15 In a dream､ a vision of the night､ When a deep sleep falleth upon men, In slumberings upon the bed
content_old: 15 In a dream､ a vision of the night､ When a deep sleep falleth upon men, In slumberings upon the bed

content: 16 Then uncovereth he the ear of men, And on their correction affixeth a seal;
content_old: 16 Then uncovereth he the ear of men, And on their correction affixeth a seal;

content: 17 To turn a son of earth from his deed, While yet pride from man he concealeth:
content_old: 17 To turn a son of earth from his deed, While yet pride from man he concealeth:

content: 18 He keepeth back his soul from the pit, And his life from passing away by a weapon.
content_old: 18 He keepeth back his soul from the pit, And his life from passing away by a weapon.

content: 19 Or he is chastised with pain､ upon his bed, And the strife of his bones is unceasing!
content_old: 19 Or he is chastised with pain､ upon his bed, And the strife of his bones is unceasing!

content: 20 So that his life maketh loathsome his food, And his soul､ dainty meat;
content_old: 20 So that his life maketh loathsome his food, And his soul､ dainty meat;

content: 21 His flesh wasteth away out of sight, And bared are the bones once unseen;
content_old: 21 His flesh wasteth away out of sight, And bared are the bones once unseen;

content: 22 So doth his soul draw near to the pit, And his life to the inflicters of death:
content_old: 22 So doth his soul draw near to the pit, And his life to the inflicters of death:

content: 23 If there hath been near him a messenger who could interpret— One of a thousand, To declare to the son of earth His uprightness
content_old: 23 If there hath been near him a messenger who could interpret— One of a thousand, To declare to the son of earth His uprightness

content: 24 Then hath he shewed him favour､ and said､ Set him free from going down to the pit, I have found a price of redemption!
content_old: 24 Then hath he shewed him favour､ and said､ Set him free from going down to the pit, I have found a price of redemption!

content: 25 His flesh hath been made fresher than a child’s, He hath returned to the days of his youth;
content_old: 25 His flesh hath been made fresher than a child’s, He hath returned to the days of his youth;

content: 26 He made supplication unto God､ who hath accepted him､ And he hath beheld his face with a shout of triumph, Thus hath he given back to man his righteousness.
content_old: 26 He made supplication unto God､ who hath accepted him､ And he hath beheld his face with a shout of triumph, Thus hath he given back to man his righteousness.

content: 27 He sang before men､ and said､ I sinned､ and uprightness I perverted, Yet he requited me not;
content_old: 27 He sang before men､ and said､ I sinned､ and uprightness I perverted, Yet he requited me not;

content: 28 He hath ransomed my soul from passing away into the pit,— And my life in the light shall have vision.
content_old: 28 He hath ransomed my soul from passing away into the pit,— And my life in the light shall have vision.

content: 29 Lo! all these things doth GOD work, Two ways､ three､ with a man;
content_old: 29 Lo! all these things doth GOD work, Two ways､ three､ with a man;

content: 30 To bring back his soul from the pit, To enlighten with the light of the living.
content_old: 30 To bring back his soul from the pit, To enlighten with the light of the living.

content: 31 Mark well､ O Job､ and hearken to me, Be silent, and I will speak:
content_old: 31 Mark well､ O Job､ and hearken to me, Be silent, and I will speak:

content: 32 If there is anything to say reply to me, Speak､ for I desire to justify thee;
content_old: 32 If there is anything to say reply to me, Speak､ for I desire to justify thee;

content: 1 Furthermore Elihu responded､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Furthermore Elihu responded､ and said:—

content: 2 Hear､ ye wise men､ my words, And ye who know give ear unto me;
content_old: 2 Hear､ ye wise men､ my words, And ye who know give ear unto me;

content: 3 For the ear trieth words, As the palate tasteth in eating.
content_old: 3 For the ear trieth words, As the palate tasteth in eating.

content: 4 What is right let us choose for ourselves, Let us know､ among ourselves､ what is good;
content_old: 4 What is right let us choose for ourselves, Let us know､ among ourselves､ what is good;

content: 5 For Job hath said— I am righteous, But GOD hath turned away my right;
content_old: 5 For Job hath said— I am righteous, But GOD hath turned away my right;

content: 6 Concerning mine own right shall I tell a falsehood? Incurable is my disease—not for any transgression.
content_old: 6 Concerning mine own right shall I tell a falsehood? Incurable is my disease—not for any transgression.

content: 7 What man is like Job? He drinketh in scoffing like water;
content_old: 7 What man is like Job? He drinketh in scoffing like water;

content: 8 And is on the way to keep company､ with the workers of iniquity, And to walk with lawless men.
content_old: 8 And is on the way to keep company､ with the workers of iniquity, And to walk with lawless men.

content: 9 For he hath said､ It profiteth not a man, When his good pleasure is with God.
content_old: 9 For he hath said､ It profiteth not a man, When his good pleasure is with God.

content: 10 Wherefore､ ye men of mind､ hearken unto me,— Far be it､ that GOD should be lawless, Or the Almighty be perverse!
content_old: 10 Wherefore､ ye men of mind､ hearken unto me,— Far be it､ that GOD should be lawless, Or the Almighty be perverse!

content: 11 For what any son of earth doeth he repayeth him, And according to every man’s course he causeth him to find.
content_old: 11 For what any son of earth doeth he repayeth him, And according to every man’s course he causeth him to find.

content: 12 Nay､ verily GOD will not condemn unjustly,— Nor the Almighty pervert justice.
content_old: 12 Nay､ verily GOD will not condemn unjustly,— Nor the Almighty pervert justice.

content: 13 Who set him in charge of the earth? Or who appointed him the whole world?
content_old: 13 Who set him in charge of the earth? Or who appointed him the whole world?

content: 14 If he should set against him his heart, His spirit and his inspiration unto himself he should withdraw
content_old: 14 If he should set against him his heart, His spirit and his inspiration unto himself he should withdraw

content: 15 All flesh together would cease to breathe, And the earth-born unto dust would return.
content_old: 15 All flesh together would cease to breathe, And the earth-born unto dust would return.

content: 16 If then thou hast understanding hear this, Give thou ear to the teaching of my words:—
content_old: 16 If then thou hast understanding hear this, Give thou ear to the teaching of my words:—

content: 17 Shall the very hater of right control? Or the just—the mighty one wilt thou condemn?
content_old: 17 Shall the very hater of right control? Or the just—the mighty one wilt thou condemn?

content: 18 Doth one say to a king､ Abandoned one! Or Lawless one! unto nobles?
content_old: 18 Doth one say to a king､ Abandoned one! Or Lawless one! unto nobles?

content: 19 For he hath shewn no respect of persons unto princes､ Neither hath he recognised the rich rather than the poor? For the work of his hands are they all.
content_old: 19 For he hath shewn no respect of persons unto princes､ Neither hath he recognised the rich rather than the poor? For the work of his hands are they all.

content: 20 In a moment they die､ even in the middle of the night,— A people are convulsed when they pass away, A mighty one is removed without hand;
content_old: 20 In a moment they die､ even in the middle of the night,— A people are convulsed when they pass away, A mighty one is removed without hand;

content: 21 For his eyes are on the ways of a man, And all his footsteps he beholdeth,—
content_old: 21 For his eyes are on the ways of a man, And all his footsteps he beholdeth,—

content: 22 No darkness､ and no death-shade, Where the workers of iniquity may hide.
content_old: 22 No darkness､ and no death-shade, Where the workers of iniquity may hide.

content: 23 For unto no man doth he appoint a repetition,— In going unto GOD､ in judgment;
content_old: 23 For unto no man doth he appoint a repetition,— In going unto GOD､ in judgment;

content: 24 He shattereth mighty ones unsearchably, And setteth up others in their stead:
content_old: 24 He shattereth mighty ones unsearchably, And setteth up others in their stead:

content: 25 Therefore he observeth their works,— And overturneth them in a night､ and they are crushed;
content_old: 25 Therefore he observeth their works,— And overturneth them in a night､ and they are crushed;

content: 26 In the place of lawless men hath he chastised them､ In presence of beholders.
content_old: 26 In the place of lawless men hath he chastised them､ In presence of beholders.

content: 27 Forasmuch as they turned from following him, And none of his ways did they teach;
content_old: 27 Forasmuch as they turned from following him, And none of his ways did they teach;

content: 28 Causing to reach him the outcry of the poor, Yea the outcry of the oppressed he heareth.
content_old: 28 Causing to reach him the outcry of the poor, Yea the outcry of the oppressed he heareth.

content: 29 When he giveth quiet who then shall condemn? And when he hideth his face who then shall sing of him? Whether unto a nation or unto mankind altogether,
content_old: 29 When he giveth quiet who then shall condemn? And when he hideth his face who then shall sing of him? Whether unto a nation or unto mankind altogether,

content: 30 That impious men may not reign, Nor be ensnarers of the people.
content_old: 30 That impious men may not reign, Nor be ensnarers of the people.

content: 31 For unto GOD hath one ever said— I have borne punishment､ I will not be perverse;
content_old: 31 For unto GOD hath one ever said— I have borne punishment､ I will not be perverse;

content: 32 What I see not do thou shew me, If perverseness I have wrought I will do it no more?
content_old: 32 What I see not do thou shew me, If perverseness I have wrought I will do it no more?

content: 33 According to thy mind must he requite it､ that thou hast refused? For thou must choose､ and not I, What then thou knowest speak!
content_old: 33 According to thy mind must he requite it､ that thou hast refused? For thou must choose､ and not I, What then thou knowest speak!

content: 34 The men of mind will say to me, Yea any wise man hearkening unto me:—
content_old: 34 The men of mind will say to me, Yea any wise man hearkening unto me:—

content: 35 Job without knowledge doth speak, And his words are not with discretion.
content_old: 35 Job without knowledge doth speak, And his words are not with discretion.

content: 36 Would that Job might be tested to the uttermost, For replying with the men of iniquity;
content_old: 36 Would that Job might be tested to the uttermost, For replying with the men of iniquity;

content: 1 Moreover Elihu responded､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Moreover Elihu responded､ and said:—

content: 2 This dost thou think to be right? Thou hast said— My righteousness is more than GOD’S.
content_old: 2 This dost thou think to be right? Thou hast said— My righteousness is more than GOD’S.

content: 3 For thou dost say､ How can one profit by thee? How can I benefit､ more than by my sin?
content_old: 3 For thou dost say､ How can one profit by thee? How can I benefit､ more than by my sin?

content: 4 I will answer thee plainly, And thy friends with thee.
content_old: 4 I will answer thee plainly, And thy friends with thee.

content: 5 Look at the heavens and see,— And survey the skies—they are higher than thou.
content_old: 5 Look at the heavens and see,— And survey the skies—they are higher than thou.

content: 6 lf thou sinnest what canst thou work against him? Or if thy transgressions be multiplied what canst thou do unto him?
content_old: 6 lf thou sinnest what canst thou work against him? Or if thy transgressions be multiplied what canst thou do unto him?

content: 7 If thou art righteous what canst thou give unto him? Or what at thy hand can he accept?
content_old: 7 If thou art righteous what canst thou give unto him? Or what at thy hand can he accept?

content: 8 Unto a man like thyself might thy lawlessness reach, And unto a son of the earth-born thy righteousness.
content_old: 8 Unto a man like thyself might thy lawlessness reach, And unto a son of the earth-born thy righteousness.

content: 9 By reason of the multitude of oppressions men make outcry, They cry for help､ by reason of the arm of the mighty;
content_old: 9 By reason of the multitude of oppressions men make outcry, They cry for help､ by reason of the arm of the mighty;

content: 10 But none saith— Where is God my maker, Who giveth songs in the night;
content_old: 10 But none saith— Where is God my maker, Who giveth songs in the night;

content: 11 Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, And beyond the bird of the heavens giveth us wisdom?
content_old: 11 Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, And beyond the bird of the heavens giveth us wisdom?

content: 12 There men make outcry､ and he answereth not, Because of the arrogance of evil-doers.
content_old: 12 There men make outcry､ and he answereth not, Because of the arrogance of evil-doers.

content: 13 Howbeit vanity will GOD not hear, Yea the Almighty will not regard it.
content_old: 13 Howbeit vanity will GOD not hear, Yea the Almighty will not regard it.

content: 14 How much less when thou sayest thou wilt not regard him! The cause is before him､ and thou must wait for him.
content_old: 14 How much less when thou sayest thou wilt not regard him! The cause is before him､ and thou must wait for him.

content: 15 But now because it is not so thou sayest— His anger hath punished, And yet hath he not at all known of transgression;
content_old: 15 But now because it is not so thou sayest— His anger hath punished, And yet hath he not at all known of transgression;

content: 1 And Elihu added and said:—
content_old: 1 And Elihu added and said:—

content: 2 Restrain thyself for me a little､ and I will shew thee, That yet—for God there is justification.
content_old: 2 Restrain thyself for me a little､ and I will shew thee, That yet—for God there is justification.

content: 3 I will bring my knowledge from afar, And to my Maker will I attribute righteousness.
content_old: 3 I will bring my knowledge from afar, And to my Maker will I attribute righteousness.

content: 4 For of a truth—not false are my words, One of competent knowledge is with thee.
content_old: 4 For of a truth—not false are my words, One of competent knowledge is with thee.

content: 5 Lo! GOD is mighty､ yet will he not despise, Mighty in vigour of mind;
content_old: 5 Lo! GOD is mighty､ yet will he not despise, Mighty in vigour of mind;

content: 6 He will not keep alive one who is lawless, But the right of oppressed ones will he grant;
content_old: 6 He will not keep alive one who is lawless, But the right of oppressed ones will he grant;

content: 7 He will not withdraw—from a righteous one—his eyes,— But with kings on the throne He hath seated men triumphantly､ and they have been exalted.
content_old: 7 He will not withdraw—from a righteous one—his eyes,— But with kings on the throne He hath seated men triumphantly､ and they have been exalted.

content: 8 But if, bound in fetters, They have been captured with cords of affliction
content_old: 8 But if, bound in fetters, They have been captured with cords of affliction

content: 9 Then hath he declared to them their deed, And their transgressions—that they were wont to behave themselves proudly;
content_old: 9 Then hath he declared to them their deed, And their transgressions—that they were wont to behave themselves proudly;

content: 10 Thus hath he uncovered their ear to a warning, And said—that they should turn from iniquity.
content_old: 10 Thus hath he uncovered their ear to a warning, And said—that they should turn from iniquity.

content: 11 If they would hearken､ and serve They should complete their days､ in prosperity, And their years､ in pleasantness;
content_old: 11 If they would hearken､ and serve They should complete their days､ in prosperity, And their years､ in pleasantness;

content: 12 But if they would not hearken By a weapon should they pass away, And breathe their last､ no one knowing.
content_old: 12 But if they would not hearken By a weapon should they pass away, And breathe their last､ no one knowing.

content: 13 Yea the impious in heart should store up anger, They should not cry for help､ when he bound them.
content_old: 13 Yea the impious in heart should store up anger, They should not cry for help､ when he bound them.

content: 14 Their soul should die in youth, And their life､ among the unclean.
content_old: 14 Their soul should die in youth, And their life､ among the unclean.

content: 15 He would deliver the humbled in his humiliation, And would uncover—in oppression—their ear.
content_old: 15 He would deliver the humbled in his humiliation, And would uncover—in oppression—their ear.

content: 16 Yea he might even have allured thee— Out of the mouth of straitness､ Into a wide space—no narrowness there,— And the food set down on thy table should have been full of fatness.
content_old: 16 Yea he might even have allured thee— Out of the mouth of straitness､ Into a wide space—no narrowness there,— And the food set down on thy table should have been full of fatness.

content: 17 But with the plea of a lawless one thou art full, Plea and sentence will take fast hold.
content_old: 17 But with the plea of a lawless one thou art full, Plea and sentence will take fast hold.

content: 18 Because there is wrath Beware lest he take thee away with a stroke, Then let not a great ransom mislead thee.
content_old: 18 Because there is wrath Beware lest he take thee away with a stroke, Then let not a great ransom mislead thee.

content: 19 Will he value thy riches? Nay not precious ore, Nor all the forces of strength.
content_old: 19 Will he value thy riches? Nay not precious ore, Nor all the forces of strength.

content: 20 Do not pant for the night, When peoples disappear from their place.
content_old: 20 Do not pant for the night, When peoples disappear from their place.

content: 21 Beware､ do not turn unto iniquity, For this thou hast chosen rather than affliction.
content_old: 21 Beware､ do not turn unto iniquity, For this thou hast chosen rather than affliction.

content: 22 Lo GOD exalteth himself by his strength, Who like him doth teach?
content_old: 22 Lo GOD exalteth himself by his strength, Who like him doth teach?

content: 23 Who enjoined on him his way? And who ever said, Thou hast wrought perversity?
content_old: 23 Who enjoined on him his way? And who ever said, Thou hast wrought perversity?

content: 24 Remember､ that thou extol his work, Of which men have sung;
content_old: 24 Remember､ that thou extol his work, Of which men have sung;

content: 25 Every son of earth hath viewed it, Mortal man looketh at it from afar.
content_old: 25 Every son of earth hath viewed it, Mortal man looketh at it from afar.

content: 26 Lo GOD is greater than we can know, The number of his years even past finding out!
content_old: 26 Lo GOD is greater than we can know, The number of his years even past finding out!

content: 27 For he draweth up drops of water, They trickle as rain through his mist;
content_old: 27 For he draweth up drops of water, They trickle as rain through his mist;

content: 28 With which the clouds flow down, They drop on man in abundance.
content_old: 28 With which the clouds flow down, They drop on man in abundance.

content: 29 But surely none can understand the burstings of the cloud, The crashing of his pavilion!
content_old: 29 But surely none can understand the burstings of the cloud, The crashing of his pavilion!

content: 30 Lo! he hath spread out over it､ his lightning, The bed of the sea hath he covered.
content_old: 30 Lo! he hath spread out over it､ his lightning, The bed of the sea hath he covered.

content: 31 For by those things he executeth judgment on peoples, He giveth food in abundance:
content_old: 31 For by those things he executeth judgment on peoples, He giveth food in abundance:

content: 32 Upon both hands he putteth a covering of lightning, And layeth command upon it against an assailant:
content_old: 32 Upon both hands he putteth a covering of lightning, And layeth command upon it against an assailant:

content: 1 Yea at this my heart quaketh, And starteth up out of its place.
content_old: 1 Yea at this my heart quaketh, And starteth up out of its place.

content: 2 Hear! oh hear! the raging of his voice, A growling sound also out of his mouth goeth forth;
content_old: 2 Hear! oh hear! the raging of his voice, A growling sound also out of his mouth goeth forth;

content: 3 Under the whole heavens he letteth it loose, His lightning also unto the wings of the earth;
content_old: 3 Under the whole heavens he letteth it loose, His lightning also unto the wings of the earth;

content: 4 After it roareth a voice､ He thundereth with his voice of majesty, Nor will he hold them back､ when his voice is heard.
content_old: 4 After it roareth a voice､ He thundereth with his voice of majesty, Nor will he hold them back､ when his voice is heard.

content: 5 GOD thundereth with his voice､ wonderfully, Doing great things､ which we cannot know;
content_old: 5 GOD thundereth with his voice､ wonderfully, Doing great things､ which we cannot know;

content: 6 For to the snow he saith､ Fall earth wards,— Also to the down pour of rain, yea the downpour of his mighty rains.
content_old: 6 For to the snow he saith､ Fall earth wards,— Also to the down pour of rain, yea the downpour of his mighty rains.

content: 7 On the hand of every man he setteth a seal, That all men may take note of his doing.
content_old: 7 On the hand of every man he setteth a seal, That all men may take note of his doing.

content: 8 So then the wild-beast hath gone into covert, And in its lairs doth it remain.
content_old: 8 So then the wild-beast hath gone into covert, And in its lairs doth it remain.

content: 9 Out of a chamber cometh a storm-wind, And out of the north cold.
content_old: 9 Out of a chamber cometh a storm-wind, And out of the north cold.

content: 10 By the breath of GOD is given—frost, And the breadth of waters is congealed;
content_old: 10 By the breath of GOD is given—frost, And the breadth of waters is congealed;

content: 11 Also with moisture burdeneth he the thick cloud, He disperseth his lightning-cloud;
content_old: 11 Also with moisture burdeneth he the thick cloud, He disperseth his lightning-cloud;

content: 12 Yea the same in circles turneth itself to and fro､ by his steering them to their work, Whithersoever he commandeth them､ over the face of the world､ towards the earth.
content_old: 12 Yea the same in circles turneth itself to and fro､ by his steering them to their work, Whithersoever he commandeth them､ over the face of the world､ towards the earth.

content: 13 Whether as a rod､ or for his earth, Or in lovingkindness he causeth it to come.
content_old: 13 Whether as a rod､ or for his earth, Or in lovingkindness he causeth it to come.

content: 14 Give thou ear unto this､ O Job, Stay､ and consider well the wonders of GOD:—
content_old: 14 Give thou ear unto this､ O Job, Stay､ and consider well the wonders of GOD:—

content: 15 Canst thou get to know of God’s giving charge over them, Or of the causing of the lightning of his cloud to shine forth?
content_old: 15 Canst thou get to know of God’s giving charge over them, Or of the causing of the lightning of his cloud to shine forth?

content: 16 Canst thou get to know concerning the poisings of the thick cloud, The wonders of one who is perfect in knowledge?
content_old: 16 Canst thou get to know concerning the poisings of the thick cloud, The wonders of one who is perfect in knowledge?

content: 17 That thy garments should be hot when he quieteth the earth from the south?
content_old: 17 That thy garments should be hot when he quieteth the earth from the south?

content: 18 Didst thou spread out､ with him､ the skies, Strong as a molten mirror?
content_old: 18 Didst thou spread out､ with him､ the skies, Strong as a molten mirror?

content: 19 Let us know what we shall say to him, We cannot set in order､ by reason of darkness.
content_old: 19 Let us know what we shall say to him, We cannot set in order､ by reason of darkness.

content: 20 Shall it be declared to him—that I would speak? Were any man to say aught he might be destroyed?
content_old: 20 Shall it be declared to him—that I would speak? Were any man to say aught he might be destroyed?

content: 21 Yet now men see not the light､ Bright though it is in the skies, When a wind hath passed over､ and cleansed them.
content_old: 21 Yet now men see not the light､ Bright though it is in the skies, When a wind hath passed over､ and cleansed them.

content: 22 Out of the north a golden light cometh, Upon God is fearful splendour:
content_old: 22 Out of the north a golden light cometh, Upon God is fearful splendour:

content: 23 The Almighty､ whom we have not fully found out､ is great in vigour,— Neither justice nor abounding righteousness will he weaken.
content_old: 23 The Almighty､ whom we have not fully found out､ is great in vigour,— Neither justice nor abounding righteousness will he weaken.

content: 1 Then Yahweh responded to Job､ out of a storm､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then Yahweh responded to Job､ out of a storm､ and said:—

content: 2 Who is it that darkeneth counsel､ By words､ without knowledge?
content_old: 2 Who is it that darkeneth counsel､ By words､ without knowledge?

content: 3 Gird､ I pray thee—like a strong man—thy loins, That I may ask thee､ and inform thou me:
content_old: 3 Gird､ I pray thee—like a strong man—thy loins, That I may ask thee､ and inform thou me:

content: 4 Where wast thou､ when I founded the earth? Tell､ if thou knowest understanding!
content_old: 4 Where wast thou､ when I founded the earth? Tell､ if thou knowest understanding!

content: 5 Who set the measurements thereof､ if thou knowest? Or who stretched out over it a line?
content_old: 5 Who set the measurements thereof､ if thou knowest? Or who stretched out over it a line?

content: 6 Whereon were the pedestals thereof sunk? Or who laid the corner stone thereof;—
content_old: 6 Whereon were the pedestals thereof sunk? Or who laid the corner stone thereof;—

content: 7 When the morning stars sang together, And all the sons of God shouted for joy?
content_old: 7 When the morning stars sang together, And all the sons of God shouted for joy?

content: 8 Or who shut in､ with double doors､ the sea, When､ bursting out of the womb､ it came forth;
content_old: 8 Or who shut in､ with double doors､ the sea, When､ bursting out of the womb､ it came forth;

content: 9 When I put a cloud as the garment thereof, And a thick cloud as the swaddling-band thereof;
content_old: 9 When I put a cloud as the garment thereof, And a thick cloud as the swaddling-band thereof;

content: 10 And brake off for it my boundary, And fixed a bar and double doors;
content_old: 10 And brake off for it my boundary, And fixed a bar and double doors;

content: 11 And said— Hitherto shalt thou come､ and no further,— And here shalt thou set a limit to the majesty of thy waves?
content_old: 11 And said— Hitherto shalt thou come､ and no further,— And here shalt thou set a limit to the majesty of thy waves?

content: 12 Since thy days began hast thou commanded the morning? Or caused the dawn to know its place;
content_old: 12 Since thy days began hast thou commanded the morning? Or caused the dawn to know its place;

content: 13 That it might lay hold of the wings of the earth, And the lawless be shaken out of it?
content_old: 13 That it might lay hold of the wings of the earth, And the lawless be shaken out of it?

content: 14 It transformeth itself like the clay of a seal, So that things stand forth like one arrayed;
content_old: 14 It transformeth itself like the clay of a seal, So that things stand forth like one arrayed;

content: 15 That their light may be withdrawn from the lawless, And the lofty arm be shivered.
content_old: 15 That their light may be withdrawn from the lawless, And the lofty arm be shivered.

content: 16 Hast thou entered as far as the springs of the sea? Or through the secret recesses of the resounding deep hast thou wandered?
content_old: 16 Hast thou entered as far as the springs of the sea? Or through the secret recesses of the resounding deep hast thou wandered?

content: 17 Have the gates of death been disclosed to thee? And the gates of the death-shade couldst thou descry?
content_old: 17 Have the gates of death been disclosed to thee? And the gates of the death-shade couldst thou descry?

content: 18 Hast thou well considered､ even the breadths of the earth? Tell—if thou knowest it all!
content_old: 18 Hast thou well considered､ even the breadths of the earth? Tell—if thou knowest it all!

content: 19 Where then is the way､ the light shall abide? And the darkness where then is its place?
content_old: 19 Where then is the way､ the light shall abide? And the darkness where then is its place?

content: 20 That thou mayest conduct it unto the bound thereof, And that thou mayest perceive the paths to its house.
content_old: 20 That thou mayest conduct it unto the bound thereof, And that thou mayest perceive the paths to its house.

content: 21 Thou knowest､ for then hadst thou been born! And in number thy days are many!
content_old: 21 Thou knowest､ for then hadst thou been born! And in number thy days are many!

content: 22 Hast thou entered into the treasuries of the snow? And the treasuries of the hail couldst thou see?
content_old: 22 Hast thou entered into the treasuries of the snow? And the treasuries of the hail couldst thou see?

content: 23 Which I have reserved for a time of distress, For the day of conflict and of war?
content_old: 23 Which I have reserved for a time of distress, For the day of conflict and of war?

content: 24 Where then is the way the lightning is parted? The east wind spreadeth itself abroad over the earth.
content_old: 24 Where then is the way the lightning is parted? The east wind spreadeth itself abroad over the earth.

content: 25 Who hath cloven—for the torrent—a channel? Or a way for the lightning of thunders;
content_old: 25 Who hath cloven—for the torrent—a channel? Or a way for the lightning of thunders;

content: 26 To give rain over the no-man’s land, The desert､ where no son of earth is;
content_old: 26 To give rain over the no-man’s land, The desert､ where no son of earth is;

content: 27 To satisfy the wild and the wilderness, To cause to spring forth the meadow of young grass?
content_old: 27 To satisfy the wild and the wilderness, To cause to spring forth the meadow of young grass?

content: 28 Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
content_old: 28 Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

content: 29 Out of whose womb came forth the ice? And the hoar-frost of the heavens who hath given it birth?
content_old: 29 Out of whose womb came forth the ice? And the hoar-frost of the heavens who hath given it birth?

content: 30 Like a stone are the waters congealed, And the face of the roaring deep becometh firm!
content_old: 30 Like a stone are the waters congealed, And the face of the roaring deep becometh firm!

content: 31 Canst thou bind the fetters of the Pleiades? Or the bands of Orion canst thou unloose?
content_old: 31 Canst thou bind the fetters of the Pleiades? Or the bands of Orion canst thou unloose?

content: 32 Canst thou bring forth the signs of the Zodiac each in its season? Or the Bear and her Young canst thou lead?
content_old: 32 Canst thou bring forth the signs of the Zodiac each in its season? Or the Bear and her Young canst thou lead?

content: 33 Knowest thou､ the statutes of the heavens? Or didst thou appoint his dominion over the earth?
content_old: 33 Knowest thou､ the statutes of the heavens? Or didst thou appoint his dominion over the earth?

content: 34 Canst thou lift up､ to the thick cloud､ thy voice, And the overflow of waters cover thee?
content_old: 34 Canst thou lift up､ to the thick cloud､ thy voice, And the overflow of waters cover thee?

content: 35 Canst thou send forth the lightnings, So that they go, And say to thee, Behold us?
content_old: 35 Canst thou send forth the lightnings, So that they go, And say to thee, Behold us?

content: 36 Who hath put—into cloud-forms—wisdom? Or who hath given—to the meteor—understanding?
content_old: 36 Who hath put—into cloud-forms—wisdom? Or who hath given—to the meteor—understanding?

content: 37 Who can count the thin clouds､ in wisdom? And the bottles of the heavens who can empty out;
content_old: 37 Who can count the thin clouds､ in wisdom? And the bottles of the heavens who can empty out;

content: 38 When the dust is cast into a clod, And the lumps are bound together?
content_old: 38 When the dust is cast into a clod, And the lumps are bound together?

content: 39 Wilt thou hunt—for the Lioness—prey? Or the craving of the Strong Lion wilt thou satisfy;
content_old: 39 Wilt thou hunt—for the Lioness—prey? Or the craving of the Strong Lion wilt thou satisfy;

content: 40 When they settle down in dens, Abide in covert､ for lying in wait?
content_old: 40 When they settle down in dens, Abide in covert､ for lying in wait?

content: 1 Knowest thou the season when the Wild Goats of the crags beget? The bringing forth of the hinds canst thou observe?
content_old: 1 Knowest thou the season when the Wild Goats of the crags beget? The bringing forth of the hinds canst thou observe?

content: 2 Canst thou count the months they fulfil? Or knowest thou the time when they give birth?
content_old: 2 Canst thou count the months they fulfil? Or knowest thou the time when they give birth?

content: 3 They kneel down､ their young they bring forth, Their pains they throw off;
content_old: 3 They kneel down､ their young they bring forth, Their pains they throw off;

content: 4 Their young become strong､ they grow up in the open field, They go out､ and return not unto them.
content_old: 4 Their young become strong､ they grow up in the open field, They go out､ and return not unto them.

content: 5 Who hath sent forth the Wild Ass free? And the bands of the swift-runner who hath loosed?
content_old: 5 Who hath sent forth the Wild Ass free? And the bands of the swift-runner who hath loosed?

content: 6 Whose house I have made the waste plain, And his dwellings､ the land of salt:
content_old: 6 Whose house I have made the waste plain, And his dwellings､ the land of salt:

content: 7 He laugheth at the throng of the city, The shoutings of the driver he heareth not;
content_old: 7 He laugheth at the throng of the city, The shoutings of the driver he heareth not;

content: 8 He espieth the mountains､ his pasture-ground, And after every green thing maketh search.
content_old: 8 He espieth the mountains､ his pasture-ground, And after every green thing maketh search.

content: 9 Will the Wild-Ox be pleased to be thy servant? Or lodge for the night by thy crib?
content_old: 9 Will the Wild-Ox be pleased to be thy servant? Or lodge for the night by thy crib?

content: 10 Canst thou bind the wild-ox､ so that—with the ridge—shall run his cord? Or will he harrow the furrows after thee?
content_old: 10 Canst thou bind the wild-ox､ so that—with the ridge—shall run his cord? Or will he harrow the furrows after thee?

content: 11 Wilt thou trust in him､ because of the greatness of his strength? Wilt thou leave unto him thy toil?
content_old: 11 Wilt thou trust in him､ because of the greatness of his strength? Wilt thou leave unto him thy toil?

content: 12 Wilt thou put faith in him､ that he will bring back thy seed? And that corn for thy threshing-floor he will gather?
content_old: 12 Wilt thou put faith in him､ that he will bring back thy seed? And that corn for thy threshing-floor he will gather?

content: 13 The wing of the Ostrich that waveth itself joyfully Is it the pinion of lovingkindness or the plumage?
content_old: 13 The wing of the Ostrich that waveth itself joyfully Is it the pinion of lovingkindness or the plumage?

content: 14 For she leaveth—to the earth—her eggs, And on the dust she letteth them be warmed;
content_old: 14 For she leaveth—to the earth—her eggs, And on the dust she letteth them be warmed;

content: 15 And hath forgotten､ that a foot may crush them,— Or the wild beast tread on them!
content_old: 15 And hath forgotten､ that a foot may crush them,— Or the wild beast tread on them!

content: 16 Dealing hardly with her young､ as none-of-hers, In vain her labour､ without dread.
content_old: 16 Dealing hardly with her young､ as none-of-hers, In vain her labour､ without dread.

content: 17 For God hath suffered her to forget wisdom, And given her no share in understanding.
content_old: 17 For God hath suffered her to forget wisdom, And given her no share in understanding.

content: 18 What time､ on high､ she vibrateth her wings She laugheth at the horse and his rider.
content_old: 18 What time､ on high､ she vibrateth her wings She laugheth at the horse and his rider.

content: 19 Couldst thou give—to the Horse—strength? Couldst thou clothe his neck with the quivering mane?
content_old: 19 Couldst thou give—to the Horse—strength? Couldst thou clothe his neck with the quivering mane?

content: 20 Couldst thou cause him to leap like a locust? The majesty of his snort is a terror!
content_old: 20 Couldst thou cause him to leap like a locust? The majesty of his snort is a terror!

content: 21 He diggeth into the plain､ and rejoiceth in vigour, He goeth forth to meet armour;
content_old: 21 He diggeth into the plain､ and rejoiceth in vigour, He goeth forth to meet armour;

content: 22 He laugheth at dread､ and is not dismayed, Neither turneth he back､ from the face of the sword;
content_old: 22 He laugheth at dread､ and is not dismayed, Neither turneth he back､ from the face of the sword;

content: 23 Against him whiz the arrows of the quiver, The flashing head of spear and javelin;
content_old: 23 Against him whiz the arrows of the quiver, The flashing head of spear and javelin;

content: 24 With stamping and rage he drinketh up the ground,— He will not stand still when the horn soundeth;
content_old: 24 With stamping and rage he drinketh up the ground,— He will not stand still when the horn soundeth;

content: 25 As oft as the horn soundeth he saith､ Aha! And from afar he scenteth the battle,— The thunder of commanders and the war-cry.
content_old: 25 As oft as the horn soundeth he saith､ Aha! And from afar he scenteth the battle,— The thunder of commanders and the war-cry.

content: 26 Is it by thine understanding that the Bird of Passage betaketh him to his pinions? Spreadeth out his wings to the south?
content_old: 26 Is it by thine understanding that the Bird of Passage betaketh him to his pinions? Spreadeth out his wings to the south?

content: 27 Or at thy bidding that the Eagle mounteth, And that he setteth on high his nest?
content_old: 27 Or at thy bidding that the Eagle mounteth, And that he setteth on high his nest?

content: 28 The crag he inhabiteth､ and so lodgeth himself, On the tooth of the crag､ and high fort;
content_old: 28 The crag he inhabiteth､ and so lodgeth himself, On the tooth of the crag､ and high fort;

content: 29 From thence he searcheth out food, Far away his eyes do pierce;
content_old: 29 From thence he searcheth out food, Far away his eyes do pierce;

content: 1 And Yahweh responded to Job､ and said:—
content_old: 1 And Yahweh responded to Job､ and said:—

content: 2 Shall a reprover contend with the Almighty? He that disputeth with God let him answer it!
content_old: 2 Shall a reprover contend with the Almighty? He that disputeth with God let him answer it!

content: 3 Then Job responded to Yahweh､ and said:—
content_old: 3 Then Job responded to Yahweh､ and said:—

content: 4 Lo! I am of no account､ what shall I reply to thee? My hand have I laid on my mouth:
content_old: 4 Lo! I am of no account､ what shall I reply to thee? My hand have I laid on my mouth:

content: 5 Once have I spoken､ but I will not proceed, Yea twice､ but I will not add.
content_old: 5 Once have I spoken､ but I will not proceed, Yea twice､ but I will not add.

content: 6 So then Yahweh responded to Job､ out of a storm､ and said:—
content_old: 6 So then Yahweh responded to Job､ out of a storm､ and said:—

content: 7 Gird､ I pray thee—as a strong man—thy loins, I will ask thee､ and inform thou me.
content_old: 7 Gird､ I pray thee—as a strong man—thy loins, I will ask thee､ and inform thou me.

content: 8 Wilt thou even frustrate my justice? Wilt thou condemn me､ that thou mayest appear right?
content_old: 8 Wilt thou even frustrate my justice? Wilt thou condemn me､ that thou mayest appear right?

content: 9 But if an arm like GOD thou hast, And with a voice like his thou canst thunder
content_old: 9 But if an arm like GOD thou hast, And with a voice like his thou canst thunder

content: 10 Deck thyself､ I pray thee､ with majesty and grandeur, Yea with dignity and splendour thou shalt clothe thyself;
content_old: 10 Deck thyself､ I pray thee､ with majesty and grandeur, Yea with dignity and splendour thou shalt clothe thyself;

content: 11 Pour out thy transports of anger, And look on every one who is high､ and lay him low;
content_old: 11 Pour out thy transports of anger, And look on every one who is high､ and lay him low;

content: 12 Look on every one who is high､ and humble him, Yea tread down the lawless､ on the spot:
content_old: 12 Look on every one who is high､ and humble him, Yea tread down the lawless､ on the spot:

content: 13 Hide them in the dust all together, Their faces bind thou in darkness;
content_old: 13 Hide them in the dust all together, Their faces bind thou in darkness;

content: 14 And even I myself will praise thee, In that thine own right hand can bring thee salvation.
content_old: 14 And even I myself will praise thee, In that thine own right hand can bring thee salvation.

content: 15 Behold､ I pray thee､ the Hippopotamus､ which I made with thee, Grass—like the ox he eateth;
content_old: 15 Behold､ I pray thee､ the Hippopotamus､ which I made with thee, Grass—like the ox he eateth;

content: 16 Behold､ I pray thee､ his strength in his loins, And his force､ in the muscles of his belly;
content_old: 16 Behold､ I pray thee､ his strength in his loins, And his force､ in the muscles of his belly;

content: 17 He bendeth down his tail like a cedar, The sinews of his thighs are twisted together;
content_old: 17 He bendeth down his tail like a cedar, The sinews of his thighs are twisted together;

content: 18 His bones are barrels of bronze, His frame is like hammered bars of iron:
content_old: 18 His bones are barrels of bronze, His frame is like hammered bars of iron:

content: 19 He is the beginning of the ways of GOD, Let his maker present him his sword:
content_old: 19 He is the beginning of the ways of GOD, Let his maker present him his sword:

content: 20 Surely the mountains bring produce to him, Where all the wild beasts of the field do play;
content_old: 20 Surely the mountains bring produce to him, Where all the wild beasts of the field do play;

content: 21 Under the lotus-trees he lieth down, In a covert of reed and swamp;
content_old: 21 Under the lotus-trees he lieth down, In a covert of reed and swamp;

content: 22 The lotus-trees cover him with their shade, The willows of the torrent､ bed compass him about;
content_old: 22 The lotus-trees cover him with their shade, The willows of the torrent､ bed compass him about;

content: 23 Lo! the river becometh insolent—he is not alarmed! He is confident､ though a Jordan burst forth to his mouth:
content_old: 23 Lo! the river becometh insolent—he is not alarmed! He is confident､ though a Jordan burst forth to his mouth:

content: 1 Canst thou draw out the Crocodile with a fish-hook? Or with a cord canst thou fasten down his tongue?
content_old: 1 Canst thou draw out the Crocodile with a fish-hook? Or with a cord canst thou fasten down his tongue?

content: 2 Wilt thou put a rush-cord on his nose? Or with a thorn wilt thou pierce his jaw?
content_old: 2 Wilt thou put a rush-cord on his nose? Or with a thorn wilt thou pierce his jaw?

content: 3 Will he multiply unto thee supplications, Or will he speak unto thee softly?
content_old: 3 Will he multiply unto thee supplications, Or will he speak unto thee softly?

content: 4 Will he solemnise a covenant with thee? Wilt thou take him for a life-long servant?
content_old: 4 Will he solemnise a covenant with thee? Wilt thou take him for a life-long servant?

content: 5 Wilt thou sport with him､ as with a little bird? Or wilt thou bind him､ for thy maidens?
content_old: 5 Wilt thou sport with him､ as with a little bird? Or wilt thou bind him､ for thy maidens?

content: 6 Shall the companions bargain over him? Or will they part him among the traders?
content_old: 6 Shall the companions bargain over him? Or will they part him among the traders?

content: 7 Wilt thou fill､ with darts､ his skin? Or､ with fish-spears､ his head?
content_old: 7 Wilt thou fill､ with darts､ his skin? Or､ with fish-spears､ his head?

content: 8 Lay thou upon him thy hand, Remember the battle—no more!
content_old: 8 Lay thou upon him thy hand, Remember the battle—no more!

content: 9 Lo! any hope of him hath been found deceptive, Even at the sight of him shall not one be overwhelmed?
content_old: 9 Lo! any hope of him hath been found deceptive, Even at the sight of him shall not one be overwhelmed?

content: 10 None so bold that he will rouse him! Who then is he that before me can stand?
content_old: 10 None so bold that he will rouse him! Who then is he that before me can stand?

content: 11 Who hath forestalled me､ that I may repay him? Under all the heavens mine it is!
content_old: 11 Who hath forestalled me､ that I may repay him? Under all the heavens mine it is!

content: 12 I will not pass by in silence his parts, Or the matter of strength､ or the grace of his armour.
content_old: 12 I will not pass by in silence his parts, Or the matter of strength､ or the grace of his armour.

content: 13 Who hath removed his outer garment, Through his double row of teeth who would enter?
content_old: 13 Who hath removed his outer garment, Through his double row of teeth who would enter?

content: 14 The doors of his face who hath opened? The circles of his teeth are a terror!
content_old: 14 The doors of his face who hath opened? The circles of his teeth are a terror!

content: 15 A pride are his arched sides, Closed up､ with a firm seal;
content_old: 15 A pride are his arched sides, Closed up､ with a firm seal;

content: 16 One to another they join, And air cannot enter between them;
content_old: 16 One to another they join, And air cannot enter between them;

content: 17 Each to its fellow they cleave, They grasp each other､ and cannot be parted;
content_old: 17 Each to its fellow they cleave, They grasp each other､ and cannot be parted;

content: 18 His sneezings flash forth light, And his eyes are like the eyelashes of the dawn;
content_old: 18 His sneezings flash forth light, And his eyes are like the eyelashes of the dawn;

content: 19 Out of his mouth torches dart forth, Sparks of fire escape;
content_old: 19 Out of his mouth torches dart forth, Sparks of fire escape;

content: 20 Out of his nostrils proceedeth smoke, Like a blown pot and rushes;
content_old: 20 Out of his nostrils proceedeth smoke, Like a blown pot and rushes;

content: 21 His breath setteth coals ablaze, And a flame out of his mouth proceedeth;
content_old: 21 His breath setteth coals ablaze, And a flame out of his mouth proceedeth;

content: 22 In his neck lodgeth strength, And before him danceth dismay;
content_old: 22 In his neck lodgeth strength, And before him danceth dismay;

content: 23 The dewlaps of his flesh cleave together, Hardened upon him they cannot be moved;
content_old: 23 The dewlaps of his flesh cleave together, Hardened upon him they cannot be moved;

content: 24 His heart is hardened like a stone, Yea hardened､ like the nether millstone;
content_old: 24 His heart is hardened like a stone, Yea hardened､ like the nether millstone;

content: 25 At his rising up mighty men are afraid, By reason of terror they are beside themselves:
content_old: 25 At his rising up mighty men are afraid, By reason of terror they are beside themselves:

content: 26 As for him that assaileth him the sword availeth not, Spear､ dart､ or coat of mail:
content_old: 26 As for him that assaileth him the sword availeth not, Spear､ dart､ or coat of mail:

content: 27 He counteth iron as broken straw, And bronze as rotten wood:
content_old: 27 He counteth iron as broken straw, And bronze as rotten wood:

content: 28 The arrow will not make him flee, Into chaff are sling-stones changed by him:
content_old: 28 The arrow will not make him flee, Into chaff are sling-stones changed by him:

content: 29 As a straw is a club accounted, And he laugheth at the whir of the javelin;
content_old: 29 As a straw is a club accounted, And he laugheth at the whir of the javelin;

content: 30 His underparts are points of potsherd, A pointed threshing roller spreadeth out upon the slime;
content_old: 30 His underparts are points of potsherd, A pointed threshing roller spreadeth out upon the slime;

content: 31 He causeth to boil､ as a cauldron､ the raging deep, The sea he maketh like a brewing vessel:
content_old: 31 He causeth to boil､ as a cauldron､ the raging deep, The sea he maketh like a brewing vessel:

content: 32 After him he lighteth up a path, One might think the resounding deep to be hoary!
content_old: 32 After him he lighteth up a path, One might think the resounding deep to be hoary!

content: 33 There is not—upon the dust—his like, That hath been made to be without fear;
content_old: 33 There is not—upon the dust—his like, That hath been made to be without fear;

content: 1 Then Job responded to Yahweh､ and said:—
content_old: 1 Then Job responded to Yahweh､ and said:—

content: 2 I know that all things thou canst do, And that no purpose can be withholden from thee.
content_old: 2 I know that all things thou canst do, And that no purpose can be withholden from thee.

content: 3 Who is it that hideth counsel without knowledge? Therefore have I declared､ but not understood, Things too wonderful for me､ which I could not know.
content_old: 3 Who is it that hideth counsel without knowledge? Therefore have I declared､ but not understood, Things too wonderful for me､ which I could not know.

content: 4 Hear thou､ I pray thee､ and I will speak, I will ask thee､ and inform thou me.
content_old: 4 Hear thou､ I pray thee､ and I will speak, I will ask thee､ and inform thou me.

content: 5 By the､ hearing of the ear had I heard thee, But now mine own eye hath seen thee.
content_old: 5 By the､ hearing of the ear had I heard thee, But now mine own eye hath seen thee.

content: 6 For this cause I tremble and repent, On dust and ashes.
content_old: 6 For this cause I tremble and repent, On dust and ashes.

content: 7 And it came to pass after Yahweh had spoken these words unto Job that Yahweh said unto Eliphaz the Temanite､ Kindled is mine anger against thee and against thy two friends, for ye have not spoken concerning me the thing that is right､ like my servant Job.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass after Yahweh had spoken these words unto Job that Yahweh said unto Eliphaz the Temanite､ Kindled is mine anger against thee and against thy two friends, for ye have not spoken concerning me the thing that is right､ like my servant Job.

content: 8 Now therefore､ take unto you seven bullocks and seven rams､ and go unto my servant Job､ and ye shall offer up an ascending-sacrifice in your own behalf, and Job my servant shall pray over you,—for him will I accept､ that I may not deal out to you disgrace, because ye have not spoken concerning me the thing that is right､ like my servant Job.
content_old: 8 Now therefore､ take unto you seven bullocks and seven rams､ and go unto my servant Job､ and ye shall offer up an ascending-sacrifice in your own behalf, and Job my servant shall pray over you,—for him will I accept､ that I may not deal out to you disgrace, because ye have not spoken concerning me the thing that is right､ like my servant Job.

content: 9 So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according to that which Yahweh had spoken unto them,—and Yahweh accepted Job.
content_old: 9 So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according to that which Yahweh had spoken unto them,—and Yahweh accepted Job.

content: 10 And Yahweh himself turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed in behalf of his friends,—and Yahweh increased all that Job had possessed､ unto twice as much.
content_old: 10 And Yahweh himself turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed in behalf of his friends,—and Yahweh increased all that Job had possessed､ unto twice as much.

content: 11 Then came unto him all his brethren and all his sisters､ and all his former acquaintances､ and they did eat bread with him in his house,—and shewed sympathy with him and comforted him, over all the calamity which Yahweh had brought upon him,—and they gave him､ every one a weight of money, and every one､ a ring of gold.
content_old: 11 Then came unto him all his brethren and all his sisters､ and all his former acquaintances､ and they did eat bread with him in his house,—and shewed sympathy with him and comforted him, over all the calamity which Yahweh had brought upon him,—and they gave him､ every one a weight of money, and every one､ a ring of gold.

content: 12 And Yahweh blessed the latter end of Job､ more than his beginning,—and so he came to have fourteen thousand sheep､ and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen､ and a thousand she-asses.
content_old: 12 And Yahweh blessed the latter end of Job､ more than his beginning,—and so he came to have fourteen thousand sheep､ and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen､ and a thousand she-asses.

content: 13 And he came to have seven sous､ and three daughters;
content_old: 13 And he came to have seven sous､ and three daughters;

content: 14 and he called the name of the first Jemima, and the name of the second Kezia,—and the name of the third､ Keren-happuch.
content_old: 14 and he called the name of the first Jemima, and the name of the second Kezia,—and the name of the third､ Keren-happuch.

content: 15 And there were found no women so fair as the daughters of Job､ in all the land,—and their father gave them an inheritance､ in the midst of their brethren.
content_old: 15 And there were found no women so fair as the daughters of Job､ in all the land,—and their father gave them an inheritance､ in the midst of their brethren.

content: 16 And Job lived､ after this, a hundred and forty years,—and saw his sons and his sons’ sons, four generations.
content_old: 16 And Job lived､ after this, a hundred and forty years,—and saw his sons and his sons’ sons, four generations.
